Reviews.Title: “Rooms standard "Best Western" type/Waterpark great for lower elementary ages”
Reviews.Author: a_midwestern_family
Reviews.Content: Indoor waterpark features a very nice "wet jungle gym" encouraging climbing to a couple average size slides. The most exciting feature of the park is a gigantic waterbucket that dumps an intimidating amount of water every now and then. There is a lazy river and additional pools. This park would be most exciting for younger age children. The motel structure itself is dated with average "Best Western" type rooms. In management's defense, any motel that continually hosts young families is going to take an exceptional amount of wear and tear. We'll stay somewhere a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Package Deal”
Reviews.Author: mogirlMissouri
Reviews.Content: Our family was looking for somewhere to get away over Labor Day weekend. The forecast was calling for rain so we needed something that would provide a lot of indoor fun. The package deal at the Grand Country Inn offered the perfect solution! It was a great value paying only $318 for two nights, two shows, free pizza, indoor mini golf and a game card. The package also included the indoor water park, which we did not visit because our 12 year old doesn't like to swim. But even without taking advantage of the water park, we still got a great value for our money. We found the pet show and comedy show both very entertaining. The deal came with vouchers for two large pizzas which our family of three used to cover lunch the two days we were there. I enjoyed the convenience of staying somewhere that provided entertainment and shopping and food all in one location where we didn't have to get in the car and fight traffic going from one place to the next. And while the hotel room wasn't anything fancy, it was clean and we didn't have any complaints. Check in and check out were both very quick and the staff seemed very friendly. We will definitely keep this place in mind for future vacations especially when the weather is cold or wet. Great value and savings!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: sheryl S
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed to report false advertisement that is offered through the web page from Grand Country Inn in Branson Mo. The package offers for 318.00 two shows, two pizzas, mini golf game and $10.00 voucher for fun spot. Upon our cash in for the show, we were told only one show was actually available and to ask for compensation from the front desk. When asking for any, the "supervisor" stated no. I stated the advertisement offers two shows and she merely stated "sorry" with no offer of satisfaction. Very disappointed of the scam. Bathroom door in room was broken along with light out in bathroom. Walls super thin. Will not be back to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great inside water park for kids”
Reviews.Author: TheKCOptimist
Reviews.Content: I could not find a way to review the water park only. We did not stay at the hotel, but paid for the water park twice in one week. I went with my five year old, and somehow we were kept busy for about four hours each time. Our red hair keeps us inside during the prime summer hours, so this was a great find for us. We spent lots of time going down the two tube slides; we also liked the lazy river and pool with three basketball hoops and many balls. There were three rope/ cargo nets to climb- I'd recommend water shoes, since the ropes kind of hurt. Watch out for surprise water dumpings from kids playing above you. Every 5 - 10 minutes, the big bucket of water dumps out, and that is fun to watch. I could sit in one of the two hot tubs and watch my daughter when I tired of playing with her. We played outside a little bit; for some reason my daughter loved the frog slide. They provide dry towels inside, and there's a concession stand and area for people just to watch. There were lots of elementary age kids, and a handful of teens, but I'd say this attraction is best suited to younger kids and 'tweens. I saw many younger kids who were disappointed that they weren't tall enough for the slides. The outside area and lazy river were still options for them. We will likely go back the next time we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRG_DSM
Reviews.Content: Room was reasonably clean but one of the beds was broken which we didn't find out until the middle of the night when it fell off the frame and could not be reset properly because the frame was broken. Front desk offered zero adjustment and no sympathy, not even an apology or the bat of an eyelid which led me to conclude they know their facilities are subpar and it's a regular occurance. There is absolutely no amenity, there wasn't even a pen in the room to write with, no little bottles of shampoo, no ice bucket, short on towles, etc. and check-out is 10am. Waterpark is really basic and old but one plus to the waterpark was that it was not crowded as a result. Outdoor waterpark was really tiny, a small pool and pirate ship, almost could be said there was no outdoor waterpark. Snack bar at waterpark was good with decent prices and staff at the snack bar was ironically more friendly than the staff at the front desk. Even though the waterpark was a good diversion at the end of the day, I wouldn't ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: MW66325
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. Our room was ready two hours before the specified check in time and check in was fast with a friendly clerk. They honored our request for a room close to the pool and waterpark. We were literally steps away from both. The room keys were the old fashioned key kind and I was expecting an out of date room when they gave me the keys. I was surprised to find our room was large and very, very clean. I was impressed with the cleanliness of the room, until the carpets turned the bottom of our feet black. Everything else was spotless (you could smell the disinfectant) and the beds were nice and comfy. The waterpark was fun, a little on the small side, but it was for the kids. Not a lot of things for the adults to do, though. We only spent the money to stay here for our son, though, so we weren't disappointed at all. We ate at the buffet and everything was superb. The party for hotel guests that night was super fun and the balloon drop was awesome. We enjoyed free cake and dessert pizza and my husband and son had fun doing lazer tag. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay here but visited the Splash Country water park”
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: We opted to visit Splash Country waterpark instead of White Water due to the fact that we had a two and six year old with us. The six year old would have been too short (and too nervous) for many of the larger rides at White Water; plus it was 103 degrees, so the heat would have been exhausting. So Splash Country worked out well with its indoor water park. Big plus: half the price of White Water. We spent $60 for the four of us (because we weren't guests of the hotel). White Water would have cost us more than $120. If you're looking for a big park with lots of rides, this is not for you. It's perfect for families with small kids who are intimidated by big slides. Just big enough that the kids don't get bored, but not so big that you're worried about keeping track of them while you relax.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely clean room, really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: nicoleo1985
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay here and take my daughter to the water park. So we splurged and were really happy with our stay. The room lacked a refrigerator and microwave but it was VERY CLEAN. This was the cleanest motel bathroom I've ever experienced and I've even stayed at ritzy hotels before and they didn't compare. Our room was in 2nd building behind the music hall and buffet so there was no problem with noise from the traffic. The water park was really fun with alot to do. I really enjoyed the oversized hot tubs and lazy river. The air conditioning worked well and the beds were comfortable. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “4 Night 5 Day All Inclusive Stay”
Reviews.Author: jdawg110
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying im not a great fan of country or gospel music so Branson should of been a bit out of my league. Boy was I wrong. We checked in at 1000am. Its a no brainer to know the room was not ready but our package was. We took advantage of the all inclusive food by eating all our meals at the resort except for Dixie Stampede. All the employees were very nice and after the first day knew us by name. Grand Buffet wasnt Vegas great but was good. Kids 10 and 15 loved the idea that they could go to the pizza joint or hamburger stand and order what they wanted anytime they wanted. Loved the shows. New South the headliner is a very good quartet. The fiddle player in the band played the 2nd best fiddle I have ever heard second to Charlie Daniels. Kids loved the pet show and the comedy show was decent as well. Our seats for every show were either center front or center 2nd row. Great seats. Also the seat for Dixie Stampede were priority seats which was awesome. Room was ready at 300pm just as they said it would be. My youngest daughter loved the waterpark. She spent alot of time in the inside one course she was there to sneak burgers too. Only two complaints were that the carpent was wet under the air conditioner. Im sure caused by the door being open during made service. Was dried up and had no other problems. Second complaint is that if your gonna have all inclusive then dont limit the entertainment to mini golf only. Laser tag and bumper cars would have been nice for the kids. All in all a good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst place I have ever stayed in my life! it is a VERY VERY over priced lowest version of a Motel 6. The Mattresses were very old as well as worn down..the box springs were mashed almost completely the bedspreads were some of those my Grandmother owned back in the 60s...the bathroom was very small and you could hardly turn around in it after you showered but the overrall cleanliness was ok. The carpet looked really nasty when you stepped out of the bed you immediatly stepped into your shoes oh did I meantion there was a total of nine of us in three rooms #334,336 & 338 we all slept in our clothes everynight because we did not feel comfortable in the beds This was our first visit to Branson and it will be a memorible one because of this hotel and we will never ever go to Branson again in fear that the other places to stay will be the same. I could not get my money back because it was nonrefundable after the 23rd. The web site should be deemed false advertisement because it is nothing like the pictures, also no refigerator or microwave....REALLY! I would not stay in this motel 6 if they offered it to me FREE! Feel free to contact me anytime regarding this stay! Margaret Hightower-Burden 1448 N Cincinnati Ct Tulsa, Oklahoma 74106 918-724-3789

Reviews.Title: “Cleaning staff stole my wedding ring.”
Reviews.Author: Scbear46
Reviews.Content: The cleaning staff stole a necklace and wedding ring out of the room. I had to drove two hours back to the hotel and file a police report. It sure would have been nice to have it turned into the office instead of stolen. And the resort didn't offer a single thing for my troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Grand disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: Skelagant
Reviews.Content: Wow!! For the price, we were expecting a lot more. This is a motel 6 at best. The rooms and furnishing are outdated, the carpet is old, stained and has a smell to it. Air conditioning unit cover is falling off. The Internet site gave us NO options on what room we wanted. They have NO refund policy if you get here and are not happy with the room, even of you haven't set your stuff down! Their website claims they've been treating people like family since 1971 or what ever, I'm glad they're not in my family!! For the price, this is ABSOLUTELY not worth it. If the rates were HALF the price, around $59-$69, maybe then it would be an ok place to stay. Would NOT recommend. Beds are not comfortable either!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms & Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: Melissa P
Reviews.Content: We returned home today from a 5 day stay at Grand Country Inn. The rooms were clean a little out dated style wise but everyone worked and felt great. We spent 2 days enjoying the indoor & outdoor waterpark as well as the individual pools for our building. The only downside that I found was the lack of follow through on some of the rules. As an example, in the Indoor waterpark there are 2 hot tubs. One is slightly cooler than the other. The very first thing that the rules say is children are only allowed with an adult in the lower hot tub but while I was in the lower hottub with my daughter there were at least 8 unsupervised children in the upper hot tub. I know it said no lifeguard on duty back there but someone in management should have done something to keep them out. Fun We played mini-golf one night at the 3-D Black Light mini golf course. It was a lot of fun. Definitely remember to bring your guest card for that game discount. We didn't get to play the laser tag or the bumper cars but we did enjoy all the arcade games at the Fun Stop. Food Also ate at the both the pizza buffet and the Grand Country Buffet. The pizza buffet was amazing. The pizza was GREAT and the price was even better. We had the breakfast buffet 3 mornings in a row. Great selection of foods to fill you up for a long day of play. The dinner buffet wasn't quite as good since there were so many foods that I can't or don't eat but everyone else in my group had a good meal. We also had some shakes from the frozen custard place next door to the pizza buffet. Their strawberry malts are delicious and no one complained about their various treats either. Last but not least keep your guest card with you since you can get free coffiee and/or tea at any of the food places.

Reviews.Title: “Obnoxious Vacationers, I Feel Bad for the Staff”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia D
Reviews.Content: The rooms are average, but let's face it, we go for the water park. The water park is nice, but the vacationers were out of control. There were young adults taking over the lazy river like drunkards on the Merimac. The hot tub was taken over by young children without a parent present. The kids working there seemed overwhelmed. The guests were intimidating them and they seemed afraid to enforce the rules. Very sad, because it is a nice place to stay for the price. This was not a good visit this time though.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at Grand Country!”
Reviews.Author: Rd0wney
Reviews.Content: We booked the all-inclusive package that included room, food, drinks, mini-golf, three shows at Grand Country, tickets to Dixie Stampede, water park, Silver Dollar City. We checked into hotel early at around 1:30 and we were told we could go ahead and eat or play mini-golf. We ate at the buffet which was pretty good. The staff was excellent at the buffet especially our waitress, Armandina! A little after 3 we went to get our keys to check into our hotel room and it was not ready until after 4:00. Not a huge problem, though. We got tickets included in package to the Dixie Stampede and it was awesome, even though it was hard to enjoy the show while eating/ being served. The shows at Grand Country were awesome! All five of us loved the three- 2 hour shows we saw at Grand Country that were included in the package! The Comedy Jamboree, the Country Jubilee, and the Amazing Pets Show. Only three of eight shows were playing while we were there. We got tickets to Silver Dollar City for two days and this was not very fun! The five of us ages 9, 11, 16, and two adults...did not enjoy Silver Dollar City and voted unanimously not to go back a second day. If you are looking for an amusement park, go elsewhere. If you are looking for commercialism...this is your place! The Gazilliion Bubbles show inside Silver Dollar City was good. The train ride and skit was pretty good. The Saloon Show was really good but you get hit up everywhere you go (this is true of Branson in general) to pay for photos. The pizza was not very good. The custard ice cream was the best! The popcorn was great! The hamburgers at the restaurant in the water park were awful! All in all, we would recommend Grand Country!

Reviews.Title: “Come for the splash park...not the accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: Thefunny
Reviews.Content: Old school dated hotel rooms but clean. Splash park, slides, lazy river all kept my kids happy and playing. Anyone over the age of 10 would get bored pretty quick in my opinion though. If I had older kids I would definately stay elsewhere and go to white water.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: boogity
Reviews.Content: When we checked in the 2 girls at the Front Desk were from another country - very hard time understanding them. Handed us KEYS - Really??? We tried questioning her about our package and the keys, but she didn't understand us. We were put in some back outbuilding on the 2nd floor the furthest away from the amenities. When we got to the room, the ceiling was cracked and falling down. Needless to say we went back to the Front Desk and said we wanted our money back - and the girl was no help. VERY OUTDATED. From the pictures on the web when we booked we thought we were getting something along the lines of a Great Wolf Lodge. VERY DISAPPOINTING. We left and went up the road and found a very nice, clean, updated place for less. We were told there that we were the 2nd people that week that they had heard the same thing from.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Nonya303
Reviews.Content: We bought the package deal for the weekend and just had a blast. The staff was incredible and the hotel is perfect for a family vacation. The rooms reminded me of the hotels I stayed in as a kid, two queen beds, TV and small table, but really that is all we needed because we were only in the room to sleep. The bathroom was spotless and the water pressure awesome! The rooms were clean, the sheets soft and it smelled wonderful. We asked for a non-smoking room and there was NO smoke residue in our room. The waterpark was clean and fun. My kids were five and eleven and they both loved it. The deepest water in either waterpark was about 3 feet so I felt confident that both kids were fine, although I was with the youngest the entire time. Even I rode the waterslide, to the kid's amazement. They have towels at the pool area and a locker room to change clothes. The kids loved the lazy river and the giant dumping bucket the most. We saw the Amazing Animal show and the Jubilee show. Both were very family friendly and the kids absolutely loved the animal show. We rode the bumper cars, and although the rink was very small, it was perfect for my five year old. We played glow in the dark mini golf and they just loved it and my 11 year old played laser tag; the first game he loved the second game he was competing with kids a lot older than him and didn't enjoy it so much. We ate dinner at the buffet the first night and it was okay. Similar to Golden Corral. I imagine it would be perfect for breakfast but we did not eat there again. The two pizzas that came with our package were delicious. We attended the kid's party at the Fun Spot in the evening and the kids really enjoyed it. They had cake and popcorn and played in the ballilator. They both won a prize in the balloon drop. It made for a late night but hey, we were on vacation. The only negative about the balloon drop is for the over five section there were some very agressive adults, I felt it should have been regulated to kids 16 and under because the grown ups didn't play well with others. This isn't a luxary resort, it is all about the kids really. Which was exactly what I was looking for and I was not disappointed. The hotel is right on the strip so during major traffic times you would do good to keep floating down the lazy river until the traffic passes. We only left the resort for a meal at Cracker Barrel, otherwise we had everything we needed right there. I did notice the Wal-Mart was just a quarter of a mile away.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay In Branson”
Reviews.Author: Karen G
Reviews.Content: We booked the Summer Fun package for the Grand Country Inn and stayed the weekend after the 4th of July 2012. Check in was fast, were assigned Building #3 that is the farthest from the Water Park (we would drive our car & park over by the water park no problem) and closest (walking distance) to the building with the Theater/Shops/Buffet and the building with the Fun Spot Game Room/Pizza. The rooms are a little on the dated side but very clean! I have stayed in a lot of different hotels and some of them just feel dirty & smell musty but our room here was clean and smelled like a freshly cleaned room every time we walked in. We had two double queen beds and was plenty of room for 2 adults & 2 kids. The water park area was not as large as I expected but is just the right size for kids aged 12 & under, there were some older kids & adults that were in the play areas and they seemed to be having fun too. The adults enjoyed the two large hot tubs & the lazy river also. We only saw one show there, Amazing Pets which was very good! Adults & kids all enjoyed it. The host/comedian/magician was very funny & kept it entertaining. The animals are really cute and didn't do any really super amazing tricks but they were very well trained. They also had a lot of audience participation which our kids were too shy to volunteer but it was still cute to see other kids involved. We ate the Grand Country Buffet just once and it was for breakfast which was really good. They have a lot of different choices and you definitely don't leave hungry! We also ate at the pizza place a couple of times and the pizza was always hot & good. We really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Country Inn and I would recommend it to families with younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation spot ever for the price.”
Reviews.Author: nana6666
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter and grand children ages 8,6 and 5. We loved it there. The staff was outstanding. The first night we were on the second floor. I called the next morning and ask to be moved to the first floor because my daughter had pins in her knee from a injury and was unable to climb the steps. They moved us right away. The pools and water parks are so much fun for the kids. Everything is right there that you will need. Fun fun fun. Will always book at the Grand Country Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Fun Fun”
Reviews.Author: travibabiesgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Country Inn, Branson, MO July 8-9 2012 and did we have a blast. The hotel room we had easily accommodated the 5 people in our party. It was clean and roomy. There is so much to do there you don't even need to leave the hotel. We watched the pet show and it was a little boring but the kids seemed to enjoy it. We did laser tag a little on the expensive side at 52 bucks for 5, but it was well worth the money because my dad who we had to beg to do it enjoyed it a lot. It was a great memory maker seeing my dad playing laser tag with my children and I. The have inside bumper cars, we didn't do it but looked like the area was too small to really enjoy it. Indoor mini golf it was loads of fun and really cool as it is 3D black light. They also have a game area where people can earn tickets and get prizes, it was a small area but it seemed to be good about giving the kids lots of tickets on many of the games. They have a mini mall type area to buy gifts, eat food, and see the shows they offer onsite. The indoor water park was tons of fun, my kids stayed busy for hours. They have lots of things that kids can play with that shoots, squirts, and dumps water on people, two water slides and a big bucket that fills with water and when the bell starts ringing it dumps the water, kids flock to it as soon as they hear the first bell, a small lazy river, and two big hot tubs (one is more of a warm tub with jets). The outside part of the water park is geared towards smaller kids and the inside also has an area for smaller children. All in all it was lots of fun, friendly staff, and no need to go anywhere else unless you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Indoor water park. Fun in the winter!”
Reviews.Author: tink77
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, lots to do even when the main attractions in Branson are closed. The family can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!”
Reviews.Author: Monica M
Reviews.Content: I guess we were expecting that at the very least we might get our moneys worth, but this was not the case! We were traveling with a 5 & 7 year old grandchildren. We have stayed in many water park resorts and this one was not good. First you do not get a email confirmation of your reservation, then when we checked in it was explained to us that the room keys were lost! ROOM KEYS REALLY???? This was already screaming STEP INTO THE 21ST CENTURY! Our room was to be located in building 4 which in reality was labeled building D... at the very back of the complex. There is no theme to this resort, unless you call waiting for a house keeper to let you in your room in 102* heat with 2 children, having to climb stairs with a weeks worth of luggage! Then to realize that now you can't leave your room because you have no key to get back in! There was no Microwave or Refrigerator and to get ice you have to use your room key! With the package we did get show tickets and we seen the Amazing Pet show, the children enjoyed it! To get any where on this complex you have to drive! So gas up before you get there! We also got 2 large pizza coupons and it was very good! However overall if I was to return to Branson I would recommend a cheaper hotel with an outdoor pole. I would not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Dated Accommodations... OK Water Park”
Reviews.Author: cadred
Reviews.Content: Grand Country's slogan is "Treatin' Folks Like Family Since 1971", which seems about the last time they have updated the decor. More seriously, other than the check-in lobby, the accommodations here are closer to the average motel rather than a modern hotel. Overall cleanliness was fine, though we did walk in on the cleaning staff at 4:30PM in our room, which was awkward. One issue was that it took a while to figure out how to use the air conditioner, which had it's control panel partially removed. After some confusion and a call to the front desk, we realized the window AC was controlled by a nearby the wall thermostat. The included water park was fun, very similar to a Great Wolf Lodge minus the bigger slides. My only complaint was that the baby pool was segregated off in a corner, making it harder to keep track of multiple kids wanting to do different stuff. On the plus side, we did appreciate the kid safe "hot tub". I suggest avoiding the Grand Country Buffet, which is discounted, but not included with the room. The food quality was mediocre at best, as was the ambiance. Overall, it was an OK place to stay, but given the reviews here, we were not very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: lop1988
Reviews.Content: This is our first time at this hotel and we really like it. It is an older property, but it's in great shape. It's very family-friendly (we have 2 families, 4 kids ages 5-10), there is plenty of stuff for the kids to do. The rooms are very clean, the beds comfortable and the showers are top-notch (hot water and good pressure!) the ownership has done a lot to update the property. if there was tornado damage earlier this year (motel is right in the middle of the area), you can't tell it. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for small kids only”
Reviews.Author: islandgrown83
Reviews.Content: This hotel was mildly disappointing. Its very old fashioned and the rooms are very outdated. All they offer is rooms with 2 queens. You can tell by the smell that the rooms haven't been updated in a long time. The hotel is located right off of the strip so it can get loud at night and if you need to get anywhere it could take a while. The pool area is designed for small children. 6 and younger. Children older then that will get bored very easily. The arcade are is awesome. Laser tag is a bit expensive but fun. In the arcade there is also a indoor mini golf course that's way awesome. The restaurant is wasn't anything special. If you have a family with young children then this place is good. The pool areas are designed for little kids and they are very unlikely to have a drowning accident there. Just keep in mind its older and right off the strip so it can or will be inconvenient at times.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Packages at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Grand Country Inn and had a great time. We got a package deal that included: 2 nights, 2 large pizzas, a round of mini golf for the whole family, 2 shows for the whole family, one $10 card for the arcade, & of course admittance to the water park. It was at a fair price for what all you got. Also, we got free tea at most of the places throughout the property. The room wasn't over the top, but was really clean and the staff was friendly throughout the entire facility. The beds were comfortable too. The location was fine since we planned to stay on the property most of the wknd, otherwise, I personally think that staying on the main drag would get to be a pain and a hassle getting to and from the hotel. Especially at certain times of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: Clifford B
Reviews.Content: We booked on line for a family of 6. When we got there the room had two queen size beds. When I asked where the other two were going to sleep I was told all the rooms were the same. I was also told I could rent a rollaway. This is after paying for six people. I asked how two were going to sleep on a rollaway and was told they were almost the size of a queen - just alittle smaller. Tried booking for 6 at another place but was stuck here in a 1950-60 era motel. So then there was the water park. After being at the Great Wolf Longe the day before I was not impressed with the facilities Additionally, I found the lifeguard unattentive. One guy with long hair spent more time playing with his hair in the mirror than watching the river float. The out door pool had two lifeguards for about 30 minutes then for the next hour there was only one. I would beware you get what you pay for. Check the facility out before booking. It your safety as well as your kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MHNOK
Reviews.Content: 3 adults and 2 children aged 6 years and less than 2 years old. We had a wonderful time with the spring package deal. The two shows included were outstanding. The kids really enjoyed the animal show at 10am. The indoor waterpark was great and was really enjoyed by all.

Reviews.Title: “The one resort has it all!”
Reviews.Author: txtravlers
Reviews.Content: We spent our 21st Anniversary here this June after not being to Branson since 1998. It was our first time at this resort and the hotel accommodations, food at the buffet, live shows, water park and miniature golf were all so much fun! Everyone associated with Grand Country was friendly and made sure their guests were 'happy'. We plan to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome waterpark!!! Kids loved it.”
Reviews.Author: rsdoze
Reviews.Content: We loved the waterpark. There's a lazy river, kiddy pool, regular swimming pools, hot tubs, slides, and kids play area. The only things they didn't have were continental breakfast and mini kitchens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Affordable, Convenient for Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: NancyWhatB
Reviews.Content: While not a top-of-the-line hotel, this Inn offered VERY clean rooms and the convenience of many attractions (shows, buffet, water park, arcade, yogurt shop) just a walk across the parking lot. We saw their "Amazing Pets" show (for our girls to enjoy) and - again - while it's not Vegas quality - it was fun, entertaining, and a nice family-friendly environment. Also, we liked that the location on the main strip was only a short block from "traffic-free" side expressway routes. (Take the Red or Yellow to the Blue and you'll see the splash house)

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: WyattsMomma
Reviews.Content: Okay, I will start out by saying that no, this is not the Great Wolf Lodge. With that being said, it was still a great time for a GREAT price! We took our 3 year old son for a two night get away and he absolutly loved this place. I would say that the water park is good for kids under 10, much older might be bored. I loved floating around the lazy river :) Room: nothing fancy, but like I said, worth what you pay. We were in the main building, on the back side so we were right across from the water park. I didn't pay extra for a "water park" room, so not sure if I just got lucky or what. I did book several weeks in advance and directly through the hotel. Food: We ate at the pizza buffet and enjoyed it. Nice to not have to leave the property. We also ate breakfast one morning at the buffett- yummy! Huge selection and reasonably priced. Again, it was great to just walk on over. Didn't try the Grand Country Buffet for any other meals.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO IN THE WINTER!!!”
Reviews.Author: rue p
Reviews.Content: Over the winter my family of 6 stayed and played here. However you are walking about 5 yards + stairs, from your hotel room to the water park and back (witch meens you are soaking wet. The grounds of the pools are stained with yellow and the ropes on the tree house are brown with rust. The lady at the front desk was barley understandable and it took a while to get checked in. The maids didnt even knock befor entering! Hope you study these first! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Erika K
Reviews.Content: This is my first review for any hotel that I have been to. I finally decided to write the good and bad of this hotel because I was a little hesitant after reading everyone else's mixed reviews. We had the spring break package, which included 1 room for 2 nights, round of 18 hole mini-golf, $10 at the arcade, 2 shows, free coffee/tea/pop and 2 pizza coupons. When we pulled up I was a little turned off. While the property is large and seemingly inviting, I was disappointed to find that the rooms were drive-up motel style. The reason this caught my eye was for safety purposes and safety purposes alone. Hotel does not do anything special for visiting on a special occasion (my husbad and I were celebrating an anniversary) and that was a little disheartening. Glad the hotel had my reservation correct because the hotel does not send confirmation emails. They just give you the confirmation on the phone. Building--We were told we were in Building 3, which was on the other side of the property. There was minimal signage and when we got to our building it said Building A. It was difficult to figure out where our room was because one side of the builing was evens and the other was odds, but it didn't make sense and our room was down a corridor that we couldn't see from the road. It would have been VERY helpful to have a map of the property and also of the building layout given to us at check-in. We had to explore each building ourselves and had a long walk to the water park. Our King non-smoking room was very spacious and the bathroom was the biggest I've seen. The lock system is a little outdated as they use actual hard keys and not key cards. The blinds in the room could use improvement as there is only one set of blinds and no sheers, meaning that you had to be extremely careful to close them all the way shut or passerbys would be able to stare into your room. The ice machine and pop machines were not well identified and we had to guess where they were. Arcade and other fun things on the property--The arcade was a tad small, but would have been better for little kids. Some seemingly unwinnable games and not too many adult games. They could expand the arcade area, or simply increase the number of games to fully utilize their space. The black-light mini-golf was fun, but short-lived. They had bumper cars on the 2nd level of the arcade, but it was small and difficult to manuever if every car is taken. The mirror maze wasn't utilized much and we never got a chance to play laser tag, as we think we would have been the only ones in there. The pizza was great and I loved that they had an ice-cream parlor on property also. We went exploring and found (on our own) that there was another indoor mini-golf course, but we were not made aware of this. The country store was nice. We never went to any of the shows although we had paid for them because they were not of interest to us. The waterpark was very far away from our building and we felt out of place as the only 2 adults without kids. Definitely geared towards families, but would've been better if they had an adult only pool/lazy river. There are no extras, like payper view movies or room service. Didn't see a fitness center on site. No easy way to checkout (no quick dropbox) and you have to go over to the front desk to hand over your keys. To sum up my long and dragged out review, the room/bathroom were spacious, the rooms/key system were a little outdated, the arcade was small and the pizza was good. You can't beat the price we paid for as many extras as we had. Would definitely recommend this hotel for families with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Marginal”
Reviews.Author: Cecil B
Reviews.Content: Water park was OK, staff was courteous and attentive. Room 227 was a disaster. Key to door wouldn't work initially, room had a sour smell, no refrigerator or microwave (available for extra $10.00), bathroom was clean, but cracks around tub and along floor-wall. No elevator, desk personnel at 4:00pm bordered on rude. Not worth the money, we won't stay again. Pizza/game room were good, but expensive too.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Weekend Trip”
Reviews.Author: liztaemd3
Reviews.Content: My mother and I took my 3 children and my nephew, ages 2, 8, 10, and 14 to Branson and we stayed at the Grand Country Inn. We got the weekend Spring Break package, which offered us two free shows, free tea and coffee, two free pizzas, 18 holes of black light mini golf, and a $10 fun card to the Fun Spot. The indoor water park was just the right size for all 4 of the kids, my 14 year old was even able to have fun. There was a toddler area for my baby, and enough hot tubs for everyone. The fun spot was nice and the evening "party" was fun for my whole crew. The room was clean and our housekeeper was efficient. The food at the Grand Country Buffet was amazing. We ate dinner and breakfast there. The amazing pet show was entertaining and you weren't short-changed on time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place for Family under 10 or maybe 14!!”
Reviews.Author: annevt30
Reviews.Content: We go to Branson atleast once a year and this is still one of our favorite hotels to stay at. The Grand Country Inn offers a mini vacation by itself. LOCATION is key! You can walk to other eating places; gas station & Tanger Mall is around the corner (my hubby and I would take turns shopping at the mall while the other watched the kids in the waterpark). BUFFET at the Country Inn has so many choices; even for picky eaters ($4 for kids & $8 for Adult lunch or $12 for dinner (ribs). A healthy meal once a day is key! ENTERTAINMENT at the Inn is extensive. The Pet show is one of the best to take young kids although the 10am show may seem too early if you've spent way too much time at the pool the night before. Although we are not big Country Fans, the Grand Jubliee Show offers a lot for the price. The 2 hr show even has a 15 min bathroom break & a chance to get photos with the stars! Small theatre so you can actually see the show! The new Fun Spot has all the arcade games; jumpy gym for tots and a pizza buffet that was inexpensive & tasty. Ask & they will make any type of pizza for you. (OR Order a pizza to go & take back to your room.) Beware of large groups & the arcade is a bit noisy & dark (keep an eye on your kids!) Teens and adults couldn't get enough from the games! You can't beat the prices if you have tots or kids under 10 that love to swim & play; then this is the place for you! The Indoors Waterpark is a great way to relax in the lazy pool while your kids climb up the tower & try to dump the water bucket. Sure, the pool can be cleaner & some parents need to be reminded of SWIM diapers but overall if you want to chill out with your family, bring a cooler & enjoy the Inn. From teens to tots, this place offers everything for a family. Even if you don't go to the local shows (a bit pricy & mostly for adults), you can still shop at the Tanger Outlet Mall, Zipline down the street or walk around. If the weather is bad you still have enough to do at this place without driving around town and sitting in your room watching tv. ***County Inn is huge & offers many choices for rooms. Pay more $$ if you want to be next to the waterpark (usually first floor rooms next to pool. Worth it if you have small kids or don't want to walk that far). Mostly families with tots & babies reserve these rooms so don't expect peaceful sleep. If you want quiet- ask to stay on the other side of the parking lot usually reserved for tour buses. A bit of a walk for pool, meals or shows but worth the peace & quiet (no babies:-)Reserve a mini frig or microwave; pack your cooler or go to walmart up the street to stock up on snacks. You can bring drinks to the pool but in plastic containers. Always ask for extra towels & coffe packs when checking in. Bring your own amenities--do you Really use the hotels shampoo or soap? No matter where we stay (now that kids are older, trying to experience different hotels) we always end up at this place for the Buffet, Waterpark, Fun Spot or shows. It's not a 4 or 5 star resort but a family fun place to relax & enjoy a cocktail (BYO), hang out with the kids at the pool, enjoy a healthly meal & Relax! You're on VACATION so Enjoy... Oh! Tanger mall offers free coupon book with military ID or AAA. Use smart phone for additional store coupons or print out at home; some store stack coupons!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break with kids of all ages”
Reviews.Author: KellyDee
Reviews.Content: I took my 16 year old daughter and her 16 year old friend, my 10 year old daughter and 5 year old son to Branson for Spring Break 2012. I chose to stay at the Grand Country Inn because of the indoor swimming park and the special package they offered for that week. The positives: Because it rained the entire time (4 days) we were there, it was a blessing to have so many indoor activities to do in one spot. The kids enjoyed several hours of the indoor park the first night after a 2 1/2 hour drive getting there. And, even though it was Spring Break, it was not as crowded as I was prepared for. The Lazy River was small, but the kids seemed to enjoy that part the most. I even got in once and jogged behind the 5 year old for a little exercise and then took a dip in one of the two hot tubs to warm up. The Fun Spot (arcade center) was also a hit with the kids that first night. You purchase a swipe card that the kids can use in all of the arcade games and bumper cars. They then can win tickets which you then in turn put into a counting machine which puts points back onto your card for prizes (cheapy prizes like you would win at the county fair). There is also a section for smaller kids like a rumpus ball zone which my 5 year old stayed in the entire two hours we were there. Between 10pm and 11:30pm, they offer free deserts and drinks and then at the end they drop balloons from the ceiling for "prizes". Tons of people and none of us found a balloon with a prize. However, I spent a lot of cash between 10:30 and 11:30 for free treats and a balloon drop (LOL). The kids did have fun and it was a time killer in bad weather. Also included in the package I purchased was two large one topping pizzas at the Fun Spot which we took advantage of on the second night. The 16 year old claimed it was the best pizza she had ever had. I took advantage of the salad bar which was also good. We also received a card which entitled us to free tea or coffee throughout our stay at the Buffett or Fun Spot. One of our dinners was at the Grand Country Buffet. I have to say it is one of the best buffets I've had. There was a large salad bar, many meats and vegetables to choose from and the best Honey Bisquits EVER - Yumm. Prices I believe were around $10 for adults $8 for children then about $2 for sodas (I forgot about the tea card that night). It ended up an expensive dinner for us but it was good. We also ate there our last morning for a big breakfast buffett before one of the shows we were going to see (in the same building). The breakfast was excellent! It held us through the show, lunch time and the long drive home. The shows were a little hokey but again, fun for the kids and it was something to do and not be in the rain and the tickets were included as part of the package. We saw the Amazing Pets show and The Comedy Jamboree. Be sure to get your tickets ahead of time as they do sell out. I reserved our tickets at least two weeks ahead of time but ended up changing days/times later to accommodate a trip to Silver Dollar City on the one nice day of our trip. Therefore, our seats ended up towards the back of the seating area and it was a little hard for the kids to see without standing up. (They do have booster seats at the front by the doors - grab one for the smaller kids as you are ushered to your seat). Now the Negative: While the room seemed very clean, I woke up to find about 4 ants crawling on the counter top in the bathroom area. I'm from the country and recognize that all the rain will bring them out of the ground especially in the Spring so it really wasn't a big deal to me. I called the front desk so they could address it while we were shopping on our first morning there. We came back to a spotless room and I never saw another ant the rest of the stay. We were put in Bldg #3 which is at the very back and down a small hill. It is a little walk to all the activities and other bldgs and probably would not have been an issue during warmer weather as I do like to walk but.....it was rainy and cool so we had to get in and out of the van and drive anytime we wanted to do something. That said, the first night back, there was no parking spot available since we stayed at the Fun Spot until midnight so I had to park at the edge of the parking lot. Still not a problem just a little worrisome that somebody might back into my vehicle. And last but not least, while it seemed inconvenient that we were stuck at the back, the regular swimming pool bldg was right beside us and the kids took advantage of it the last two nights and chose to swim instead of going to the water park. I could actually step out of the room and look into the windows of the swimming pool bldg and keep an eye on the older ones. While there is nice warm clean towels provided at the water park, we found out the hard way that there are none provided at the swimming pool. Cold, wet walk back to the room. Because they do allow the kids to have such late night activities, they do tend to come back to their rooms hooping and hollering down the exterior walkway. I have taught my kids to be respectful of the time and that others might be sleeping and I think they now know why since they were also woke up twice the first night by kids who were not being kept under control by their parents. I would NOT stay here if you are adults on a trip for peace and quiet! However, if you are there with your kids and are there for them to have a good time, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: We spent our Grandchildren's spring break (March 19th , 20th and 21st. Our trip was great! The boys had a blast, from the Water Park, The Amazing Pet Show, and the Fun Spot. I have to say the buffet at the Grand Country Buffet was the BEST we had ever had!!! Last year we took them to The Great Wolfe Lodge and we enjoyed The Grand Country Inn just as much. If I had gone by some of the reviews that were posted, we would not have gone. I am so glad that we went, what a great time we had and the price was so reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012 Trip Report”
Reviews.Author: Jack B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 day trip (March 16-18) to Grand Country Inn and had a blast! We purchased the Spring Deal listed on their web site. For the past 6 years we have spent spring break at the Great Wolf Lodge either in Kansas City, KS or in Mason, OH. We decided to try something different this year when we priced 2 night stays at Great Wolf ($500+). My wife hated the thought of going to Branson, because she thought the town portrayed people from Missouri & Arkansas as all being hillbillies. She was amazed at the variety of attractions, shops and dining options. Check-in at Grand Country was fast and efficient. We were lucky to be placed in a room on the first floor in building #1 which is the closest building to the indoor water park. (Buildings 2 and 3 are a decent walk across the parking lots). Our motel room was clean and moderately sized. Keep in mind that this place was built back in the 60s or 70s, if not earlier, so the rooms are not be huge. My wife, 8 year old son, and I had plenty of room walking and lounging in the room. It was nice being able to park our car right outside the door. The place was quiet and we did not hear any noise from our neighbors on either side of us or above us. The waterpark was nice, but definitely smaller than Great Wolf. Our son loved the water park. The place is densely laid out with a lot of activities in a smaller area. It was nice being able to sit in one spot and be able to watch him at each of the areas, instead of having to shadow him through out Great Wolf. The water was warm and clear. There was not a strong chlorine smell. Our skin and eyes did not burn after being in the water (like the Great Wolf in KCKS). The place was clean and maintained better than most modern municipal water parks. We went to the water park for about 2 hours at a time and then would leave to do another activity. Our package included 2 one toppping pizzas at the pizza parlor within the complex. The pizzas were about 14 inches. One pizza was enough for all 3 of us to eat for a meal. We ate a dinner and a lunch at the pizza parlor, so this was a great value. The package also included a $10 card to the arcade within the complex. The arcade is smaller than a Chuck E Cheese, but had a fair amount of games. Our son had fun using the arcade card. There are 2 different indoor miniature golf courses within the Grand Country complex. We used our miniature golf voucher to play the regular course. There is a black light course in the video arcade area. We had fun playing indoor miniature golf. We saw 2 shows as part of the purchased package. The first show we watched was the Comedy Jamboree. This is a great show for the family. It is more of a variety show than just a bunch of comedians standing up on stage telling jokes. There is a lot of audience participation. The 2 hosts are funny. The vocalists, band and dancers are very talented. The jokes are clean and appropriate for everyone. I would see this show again. The second show that we watched was the Amazing Pets show. Our son, who loves animals, liked the show. I thought that the talent was B grade. My wife and I felt we were watching auditions for Americas Got Talent. The host/comedian was not that great of a magician. His jokes did not get big laughs. The animal talent was pretty good, but we have seen better animal shows at other places. We did not feel that it would be worth the $70 admission if we had purchased tickets. Overall, I would recommend this place to family and friends. If you require a place similar to a Hilton or Hyatt, then do not book a trip here. This place is less than half the cost of going to Great Wolf Lodge and the package included a lot of activities. Keep in mind that this is Branson and so the buildings are going to be older. The Grand Country Inn complex is large and well maintained. We had fun at the water park, playing miniature golf, hanging out in the game room, and watching the Comedy Jamboree show. We are already talking about our return trip.

Reviews.Title: “There is better in Branson”
Reviews.Author: Nicole K
Reviews.Content: I have been to Branson 4 times and this was the worst hotel I've stayed at. I would definitely not stay at this hotel again. Check in was good, very quick and the staff was courteous. However, I'm not sure why we were given a room on the second floor when there were plenty of rooms on the first floor. There were no elevators and with small children stairs can be a challenge. This hotel is set up more like the older hotels and you enter straight from outside and there is a large window, so of course you hear every little sound from the outside. Many times during the night I hear other guest coming up the stairs and walking to their rooms. When we first walked in the room we were immediately greeted by the stench of chlorine and an old foot locker. The bathtub was very slow to drain, so while showering you have to stand in 3 inches of water. The beds were firm so if you like that they would be fine, however they hurt my back. The room is also advertised as a room for up to five people, however there are only 2 queen beds and if you want a roll away you have to rent it for $10 a night. We just had our 3 little ones sleep in one of the beds. The water park, if you want to call it that, is very small. The water seemed pretty cold, however I'm sure kids don't seem to mind. Kids were jumping in the "adult only" hot tub. My husband went to get a staff member and they were very helpful and told the kids to stop and get out of the hot tub (not sure where their parents were). Actually our kids preferred the indoor pool that is in a separate building and closer to the building we were staying in, which we preferred as well. The indoor pool was nice and the water was warm and not a lot of people were ever in there. We ate at the Country Buffet and kids really like it. It was a normal buffet so you can't expect really good food, but it was okay. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I wish I could remember her name. She told the kids to call Mamaw. We walked around they offered indoor mini golf, but our children are really too young to play so we passed on it. They also have a large arcade area but again we didn't participate in it. All the staff we encountered at the hotel were very friendly, however it doesn't counter the nasty rooms and I also don't think the water park is worth it. I worked for Great Wolf Lodge for many years and there is no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun family weekend!”
Reviews.Author: TinaOlathe
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Groupon for a weekend trip to Branson. It was an absolute blast. Every single staff member we encountered was super friendly and helpful. I had been to a couple things in Grand Country before, but this was the first time we experienced the whole package! We checked in Friday night and the process was extremely easy and well organized. The groupon package was everything they said and a couple of extras not advertised. They had an indoor pool right across from our hotel room (separate from the waterpark) that our kids enjoyed. We thought there would be towels there, and there wasn't so it was a bit chilly leaving.They had a party at the Funspot and gave free popcorn, cake, dessert pizza. Everything we tried was yummy. It didn't start until 10pm so it was a late night, but we got to do the laser tag and it was so much fun. The next day we went back and did the bumper cars, arcade, mini bowling and ball pit. Kept the kids busy for hours! We ate at the pizza buffet, and it was awesome, they made our favorite pizza to order and also had soup and salad that was fresh and delicious. We also ate at the Breakfast Buffet in the morning and it was delicious. Fresh with lots of choices. My husband said his made to order omelet was the best he ever had. We saw the Amazing Pets show. It was geared for kids, but the comedian/magician kept it interesting and amusing for everyone. The waterpark was better than I expected, although the lazy river was freezing. The kids were there for a total of 8 hours and didn't want to leave. The rooms were average hotel rooms, but the beds were quite comfy. The maid service was efficient and cleaned our room before noon. We will definetely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Amazing”
Reviews.Author: 1HotMamaof5
Reviews.Content: We bought this Groupon deal, and our regret is only purchasing one. I was not sure if it would live up to the advertisement but we were so pleased. The water park was great for the kids! My husband and I enjoyed the lazy river. Our baby was so relaxed she fell asleep on my husband while slowly drifting along the "river". Our legs are still very itchy and burning from the chemicals in the pools though. The kids have not complained about this affecting them. We went to the Amazing Pet Show. We were not awe strucked, but it kept our 4 kids ages 19 mos to 14 years very entertained. They asked to go back the next day. We played the black light 3D putt putt and had a good time! We enjoyed their decor and themes. We played bumper cars, and for $5 each I wish they would have lasted a little longer, but it was very fun. The room was suitable, as we were rarely in it. Their pillows are the best I have ever had in a hotel, and beats mine at home! The location was prime. The food was superior. I advise you not be on a diet while there, though they have plenty of low fat and low carb alternatives. But the temptation to dig into all their offerings was strong! Everyone else had tried their pizza, though not the buffet. They all enjoyed the pizza and said it ranked as one of the highest! They have a party on Friday and Saturday nights, and though we stopped by we left early as we were so exhausted, and anxious to get to sleep for the fun the next day would hold. The staff was very friendly. The place was clean. The food was supurb. The location was perfect. The conveince of having everything in one spot couldn't be beat. Overall, I am sure we will be back! I don't think you will regret going there. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway.”
Reviews.Author: Flopthis25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Country Inn over President's Day weekend. This was a last minute trip- we purchased the Groupon. The rooms- the rooms reminded me of an old Motel 6. 2 queen beds, TV, small bathroom, hair dryer. The beds were actually pretty comfortable. I seriously cannot remember the last time I used an actual key to get into our room. The only noise that we heard were from people walking by our room. We did not hear any noise from the rooms surrounding us. Buffet- holy cow!!! I am NOT a buffet person- but they had the best breakfast buffet I've ever had! We did not eat lunch or dinner there. The pizza buffet was not good. Fun Spot- aka money pit. This is an indoor arcade/laser tag/bumper car fun house. The laser tag was $8 per person and it lasted about 10 minutes. Our kids loved it. At 10:00 every Friday and Saturday they have free popcorn and cake. The cake was not good. It tasted like it had been in the freezer or too long. But the kids loved it and it's free. Waterpark- the waterpark was fun. Mainly for kids. Not many things that adults can do. We frequently go to GWL- and this was about 1/8 the size of GWL. There were 2 slides, a small pool, hot tubs, bucket of water that dumps on the kids, a playhouse. It was not connected to the waterpark and ha horrible parking. The temperature was very warm inside (we went during February) but a chilly walk to the car. Shows- we watched Amazing Pets. It was very long- 2 hours with an Intermission. Olga is very cute and the animals were 'amazing'. I don't know if I'd pay to see it again. Location- its right on the strip. Outlet malls right up the street. McDonalds, Taco Bell, and a burger place are close by. Overall- I would not return to the hotel. But I would go back for the buffet and fun spot. Hope this helps! We did not do the mini golf- but looked interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Attraction Strong; Ammenities Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: GoYeGuy
Reviews.Content: The draw of Grand Country Inn is free admittance to Splash Country water park with your room booking. Our $89 room had no refrigerator or microwave, houskeeping showed up after 4:00 PM, and was located a very long walk from the water park - not good in winter, or in bad weather. The buffet and shows are great, but there is no breakfast included with the room. Branson has lots and lots of average rooms at $30 or so / night, so do some calculating to see if the water park is worth the extra $50 / night. If you have a family, it well could be the best deal for you!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Memories!”
Reviews.Author: JohnDanitaHigh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Country Inn for the past two years with our extended family to celebrate Christmas. The management and staff are awesome! Thanks for sharing in our memories!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 'Great Wolf Lodge'”
Reviews.Author: 1sweetcharlie
Reviews.Content: We thought an indoor waterpark would be a great treat in the middle of winter, and expected it to be along the lines of Great Wolf Lodge, which my kids love. Unfortunately it was freezing inside the waterpark, if people just watching the 'swimmers' are in hoodies, you know it's cold. I know it's January, but the indoor waterpark should be too hot for people in hoodies and jeans, even some lifeguards were in sweats and winter beanies! So getting my kids to run through the water was not easy, they were shivering. There were only 2 waterslides. Supervision of the hot tubs was non-existant, an even though it said no children in the upper hot tub (the one that is actually hot) people kept letting their little kids get in, which was not relaxing, and just gross whenone got overheated and threw up. They over chlorinated all the water, the hot tub had froth, like a bubble bath, kids were putting it on their faces pretending to be santa. The over chlorinating of the water led my 6 year old to be in tears after just 3 hours in the place. We had to get eye drops from an employee to flush out her eyes (apparently it's a common problem). We left after just 3 hours, my kids can usually spend all day in other waterparks, indoor or outdoor. And I haven't even mentioned the 'changing rooms', which are just bathroom stalls. There is 1 handicapped stall which has a baby changing station,and of course everyone wants to change in that one because it's the only place you can actually turn around in, which means you can forget about diaper changes, or getting dressed without standing in line forever. I would not recommend this place, save your money and buy season passes to white water, or find a great wolf lodge near you!

Reviews.Title: “You will sold on the pictures, and scared away from it's features.”
Reviews.Author: rivershark
Reviews.Content: Ok, sorry about the rhyme. So it is off season to begin, so make sure you stay in a nice place! Not this place to start. The place tries to sell its self based off the water park. There are other indoor water park in Branson... One I know that is linked to the hotel! Every guest must find their way to the water park by walking. We where across from it luckily, but it still because a lot of work in Jan when you have a young one. We didn't venture the shows, or the Buffett, so I can not talk about them. The fun spot... Only fun if you like everything to cost money, even as a guest. Ballpit, money; bumper cars, money; laser tag, putt putt, ...money! The only time we had fun here is we ventured on the chance of fun spot featuring a party on a Saturday night from 9:30 to 10:30pm. All was free but the video games, including refreshments, cake, popcorn etc... For anyone that walks in. We kept our toddler up for the very end for just the balloon drop. She loves balloons, but did not know what to make of all the balloons popping. Very few balloons held prizes. Afterwards we finished with some custard, which was good. As for the water park... Water was cold, multiple level with steps; so be careful with little ones. Our toddler only made it 15 or 20 minutes both visits before she was shaking because she was cold. They did have a warm gaccuzzi next to the hot one for us to warm up our toddler every now and then. Kids around the age of 6 and up appeared not to be effected by the water temperature. On a last note, we rented a fridge which was worthless. Froze everything we put in it. Even at 3 and half full, everything would freeze. Our money was refunded without hassle. Just be warned. When you rent one, change the temp maybe to 2 or 1 and see how cold your items are. After a few hours. Ours arrived at 5. I would suggest a good cooler. Hope this was helpful. It is a fair review in my opinion. No punches because the experience was not perfect or anything. Staff was not rude. As with most places I have stayed, the cleaning staff hardly knew English. I would love to see more reviews that cover this aspect. Important to some. But I have become very good with signing what I need, hahaha

Reviews.Title: “An average place to stay with an average waterpark.”
Reviews.Author: mufan71
Reviews.Content: If you know what to expect up front, you won't be disappointed. The motel is similar to a super 8 or motel 6. It was clean and quiet. The service was average at best- not rude, but not overly helpful either. The waterpark kept my kids interest for a couple of hours and they had a good time, but it wasn't anything outstanding. Teenagers will probably get bored very quickly. Bring flip flops to wear in the restrooms because the floors are wet and dirty. They do not have showers in the waterpark, so keep that in mind if you check out, but want to continue to use the waterpark. It was fine for our family for a quick overnight getaway but not someplace I would want to stay for an extended visit.

Reviews.Title: “Savings, but....”
Reviews.Author: AMDinMissouri
Reviews.Content: We did the New Year's eve package and although the package was a cost savings, we were disapointed that more of the kids amenities were not part of the package as advertised. They kept the amenities open but you had to pay extra to participate and the balloon drop was dominated by adults, which made for a rude experience. The Amazing Pets and Comedy Jamboree were fun, the pizza was good and the hotel room was clean. The water in the Indoor TreeHouse was cold, but the lazy river water was warm. It was crowded but we expected that as it was a Holiday weekend. We would go back if we get a good package. Rooms need a fridge and microwave. Complimentary continnental breakfast is common in Branson and was not available in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The waterpark was freezing. Don't go if you plan on swimming.”
Reviews.Author: Mrosenthal
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked this hotel for the indoor waterpark. We have stayed at hotels with indoor waterparks before and the kids loved it so we decided to take our after Christmas vacation at the Grand Country Inn. The water at the waterpark was so cold my kids only stayed about thirty minutes each day we went. Everyone there was shivering and the hot tubs were so packed you could not even find a spot to get in. The kids were really disappointed. We also went to the Fun Spot there which was way overpriced. Some of the arcade games cost $2 to $3 to play and even the ball pit cost $3 to go inside. Even Incredible Pizza (which I also think is overpriced) does not charge for the ball pit. The only nice thing about this hotel is the staff was really nice and the Amazing Pets show was fun (but you don't have to stay there to go to the shows). We will definitely not be back.

Reviews.Title: “not enough services”
Reviews.Author: dgpkaya
Reviews.Content: we stayed 12/9/2011-12/11/2012.There is no bussines center in the hotel. if you need a printer you can't find. in the hotel handout there is no information about what does the breakfast start, when do the pools open. we had to call front desk every time.indoor pool is very poor. near the poor there are couple of chairs,thats all. there is no towel, there is no changing room. room is ok but ac works very loudly. in the room there is no fridge and microwave.if you pay that much money, you can stay different hotel instead of Gran country inn.

Reviews.Title: “Book a Different Hotel Instead”
Reviews.Author: GrantsMom12
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the Indoor Water Park- what a joke!! It was FREEZING COLD in there, which is such a shame since it really did look awesome! The employees were wearing sweatshirts and sweatpants inside there- and we were expected to enjoy that cold temperature?? The water was not heated, it was very chilly. My 4 yr old son, after about 20 minutes of trying to have a good time and forget that we were freezing, actually asked to leave and go back to our room because he was SO COLD!! He was shivering and his lips were blue! This was just horrible. In addition to that, the staff were unfriendly and not helpful at all with any ideas of things to do while in Branson for a first-time visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if we would go back....”
Reviews.Author: Jerry R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there 4 times prior and overall had a good time all of the other times, but alot has seem to change with in the two years from our last visit. Service was questionable at best, our door handle to our room was pratically falling off the door and worst of all was the life guards at the pool, there were MULTIPLE times when you would see the life gaurds sitting there fully clothed with shoes texting on their cell phones while they were suppose to be watching out for the safty for all the customers, this was very alarming and we will not go back. Management really needs to step up!!!! I would prefer to pay the extra $ and go to the other hotel with a water park that is in Branson......I know we will! Price is very good but you must beware.

Reviews.Title: “Here for the waterpark!”
Reviews.Author: ColesDad1
Reviews.Content: This hotel have some great selling points.First the indoor waterpark is a must for the kids.Don't be cheap,pay extra for a room in building 1.You'll thank me later walking back from the waterpark.The hotel rooms themselves are nothing to write home about but the are clean and do the job.Hey good luck finding a 5 star hotel in Branson!I I wish someone would build a 5 star hotel in Branson.The kids will love you for staying here,mine did! Walk over to the grand country inn diner and have the buffet breakfast and have lunch or dinner at papagrands pizza buffet.After a long day before and after silverdollar city/white water you will begin to thank this complex for meeting all your needs.I did many times over.No arguing over were to eat,getting caught in traffic on hwy 76 with everyones stomach growling.no just no but heck no.When my kids were young this was the only place in Branson for me.Use the red route to get to the hotel and the same to get off hwy 76 to get to silverdollar city at busy times.Chill out and have fun with your kids at grand country inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to brag about...”
Reviews.Author: Lillylove11
Reviews.Content: We ve stayed in Branson for well over fourteen years now and this year decided to stay with Grand Country because of the waterpark. Now believe mw the waterpark is very nice and you will have a good time there. Contrary to other reviews its not disgusting. There is the general litter that a crowd of people will bring but its not overflowing in trash. Water was warm and the lifeguards did do a good job, again contrary to other reviews. Now, on to the hotel... I was quite dissapointed in the hotel. If you stay here be prepared to recognize its near shambles. Out light switches didn't work and the lamp had no knob. The beds had mold on the wooden portions. The shower screams when you use it. Rooms are tiny. If you have to pay full price for this you ll be very dissapointed. It is, however, attached to a lovely complex and im sure this is how they can charge so much. Because of a waterpark and the mall its attached to. There is an awesome buffet next to the hotel, some cute gift shops, and a wonderful arcade and fun center to spend a good amount of time. At night they do a sort of new years eve party with a balloon drop and free desserts... Again, there was a down to this for me. When we checked in we were told it was for hotel guests only to go to the arcade and do this party. However, it is open to the public and whoever wants to hang out to do it. So again, if you are paying your full one hundred dollar a night fee, you get no special favors. It is not true that its private. Please be aware before staying here that you are paying for the ammenities that cost the property owners so much and not for the hotel itself. Im sadly dissapointed that with such a high rate, the money is not actually going back into repairs of the hotel. Whatever the case, it was not a bad stay with but also not one to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the family.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie D
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was modest. The water park was alot of fun for the granddaughters. We thought the hot tub could have been warmer for the adults. We really thought it was too much money for what you get. The location is good.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: blakewhite23
Reviews.Content: The whole family took another vacation to Branson again and chose Grand Country this time. We used one if their packages which was the Splash Thru Fall package which included 2 nights stay, splash country tickets for all of us, shoe tickets to two separate shows, 2 large pizzas, and a $10 fun card. This package is definitely one to look at along with the location of the hotel because everything you need is right there from fun things for the kids to the buffet. The rooms were ok nothing special. The main problem was that we had a problem with ants in our room. We had to keep everything put up. It was reported to the front desk and there was a guy out the next day spraying. So overall we had another good trip.

Reviews.Title: “Indoor waterpark in November ..”
Reviews.Author: RENOROX
Reviews.Content: Checked in in Thanksgiving night. Purchased the "holiday package "..our family got a room..2pizzas (see other review)..2 shows for our family (see other reviews) round of neon putt putt.. The room was very plain and average..toilet and tub area cramped..but works..big counter and sink ..coffee..iron..tv with remote...dresser ..beds were fine..room was very average..have stayed at other places in Branson..this was OK.. The waterpark inside is the big sale for this property ..The big thing for us was the use of the indoor waterpark..it was fun for the kids ..went for about an hour before it closed at 10:00..2 slides..lazy river..pool with basketballa goals..tower falling water...the bestkids for me was...the hot tub ....hot tub was really hot and felt good after day at SDC . All rooms are exterior doors..building # one is closest to water area..but they charge you $10 a night for the convience of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Kid-Friendly Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: happynJesus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Country Inn 2 nights in late October. We had a double queen room and were there with our 3 children. Overall, we had a good experience. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was helpful and friendly. However, the rooms are a little expensive for what you get. If you aren't interested in the indoor water park, there's really no point staying here. It would be nice if they'd give a discount to those not interested in swimming. Anyway, the kids absolutely loved it, and the indoor park is really great if you like that sort of thing. If the price was a little lower, and if they offered a continental breakfast, we we stay here often.

Reviews.Title: “" Call me an old Holiday Inn with a fantastic waterpark"”
Reviews.Author: T-Bone1950
Reviews.Content: First, the location is excellent if you don't want to drive up and down the main street in Branson. Now the bad. They have the old "window units" that sound like a small power plant. They do give free passes to their wonderful water park. The only bad thing about the waterpark is the smell of clorine which will make your eyes water. Another plus is good pricing to the shows at the Grand next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel, but very cool”
Reviews.Author: Heather E
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip this September and stayed at 3 waterpark hotels. This one was reasonably priced. The indoor waterpark stayed opened until 10 and the other indoor pool until midnight. It was nice to check in and actually get to enjoy the pool. After the pool closed they had a kids party at the pizza plaza. You got free popcorn, cake, drinks, and a balloon drop. Very fun for the kids. The whole stay you could get free coffee or drinks from any of the restuaunts on site. The hotel is very old. No elevator, no key cards! It actually had a real key. Atleast the water pressure was great since all newer hotels have low flow showers. It was fairly clean. Not any worse then some of the other hotels we stayed in on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family fun.”
Reviews.Author: DaeTrippur
Reviews.Content: If you want everything wrapped into one package, theirs is a great one. We wanted to take the kids out for a weekend getaway. Check with the Grand Country Inn and they were running a package that included- Motel room. 2 large pizzas, free drinks,tickets to one of their shows,water park passes, mini golf, some cash on a card for the Fun City. This place is probably about 1.5 blocks large. They have a buffet for breakfast. The Indoor waterpark was a blast. Even has two hot tub pools for the Adult "Kids". And if the crowd is not your thing they also have another stand alone indoor pool. We got to see the Amazing Pets show. Kids loved it so much we went twice. Rooms were nice,motel style rooms. The open/closed sheets they gave us were not correct so we missed a couple of hours at the fun spot area. But they added an extra day to our card expiration date so we were able to have a little fun the next morning. If you are just looking for someplace to settle for a time this is it. We did end up going around Branson which really etched the cost up a bit. But this was well worth it to me.

Reviews.Title: “rating higher than it probably deserves...”
Reviews.Author: MissouriDigirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 4th of July holiday. The indoor water park is nothing special, don't expect anything near Great Wolf Lodge type. The room was ok, the staff could have been friendlier. Life guards were downright surly.
