Fireworks went on all night in the parking lot, would have been nice for the front desk to have taken care of this, but it was the 4th, so can't mark them down for that-but their motto is obviously not customer comfort. It's just ok. Not sure if we would stay again. Outside of rooms dirty, starwells needed to be cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice amenities!”
Reviews.Author: LLC
Reviews.Content: We typically stay at a condo when we go to Branson. But when planning our days, we just didn't feel like driving everywhere. So, we broke down and stay here. The check in process was smooth and all requests were met. It was clean, but a motel feel rather than an hotel feel. Rooms were average size. Customer Service was excellent. We did have a few issues with the room, we notified the front desk and within 10 minutes there was a gentleman there to see to the issue and within 30 minutes it was completely resolved. Location was fabulous. Just about anything you needed within walking distance. We did drive to see a few shows, but other than that we were happy to be at the hotel. The kids loved the water park, it is smaller than most hotel water parks, but still a lot of fun. While I would still lean towards staying at a condo, this would be my second choice when returning to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel worth the experience, had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: rebe19
Reviews.Content: I looked this hotel up on line and read some reviews. I almost changed my reservation. But it was to close to our departure time so we just took a leap of faith. We have two children 6 yr old girl and a 12 yr old boy. The staff at check in were friendly. When we got up to our room it was clean, not a 5 star resort hotel. The air was on room was already cool. There were clean towels nice size tv ect...... we then went to the splash country it was clean they had towels there for you at the park, it was big enough that it kept the kids happy for hours, but small enough that you could let the kids go off and play and see them the whole time while we sat in the hot tub. We went to the buffet there it was ok food was ok not the best. We also went to the fun spot there on the ground and that was a great time, the mini golf and bumper cars. They had great activities planed for the kids. The prices were not bad. The hotel rate for all that activities available was great I would recommend it to anyone who has kids to stay here. If we make it back to Branson we will stay here again and again loved it.

Reviews.Title: “KIDS LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: kcdad
Reviews.Content: The rooms were just a normal hotel room. The kids really enjoyed the water park and the arcade. We all had a blast playing games, mini-golf, and the beach ball and balloon drop.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay, will probably return”
Reviews.Author: andonsmom
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here in July not August, we ended up staying here because the motel we had originally booked at was not what we expected so for the last 2 days of our vacation we choose the Grand Country. The front desk staff was very informative and nice. The rooms were really just basic, no frills rooms but they were very clean. The water park was a lot of fun for us, my son loved it. We enjoyed all the things to do right there and not having to leave and fight traffic on 76. Would probably stay here again. I wish that they offered a free breakfast in the mornings though.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Vegas Casino without the gambling”
Reviews.Author: rwdawtravel
Reviews.Content: I read some of the reviews and didn't stay here because of some of the comments about the rooms. BIG MISTAKE! I checked out the hotel while I was staying nearby and was blown away. First off if you need a room built in the past 10 years this is not the place for you. The rooms are older but VERY well maintained clean and very comfortable. The water park is great and a good escape from what can be a very expensive strip. The facility is built with an all inclusive theme where there are restaurants and entertainment within walking distance. There is the Fun Spot arcade where there is a ballon drop at 11 PM where kids can win free mini golf, bumper cars and toys. Late enough to give the family something to do in the evening and something to look forward to. Join and become a platinum member (their loyalty program) and receive several benefits including free coff and tea through out the complex and 20% off at the buffet. All in all Grand Country is a great value and will save you money and make your stay in Branson more full and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent If You Can Get A Good Deal, Otherwise Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: TravelCheapskate
Reviews.Content: Agree completely with prior review. This is a decent enough place if you can get a good deal, but it's not worth dropping a bunch of money. This is not Disney, it's Branson so don't pay Disney level prices. Kids loved the indoor water park. The free food (cake, pastries, chips) at the Fun Spot in the evenings is a definite plus. For better or worse, Branson appears to be on the decline. Most of the visitors have more tattoos than teeth. There is a tattoo parlor right across the street from this property and another one just down the road. Some of the shows are still top notch, while others are marginal at best. Branson is similar to Gatlinburg/Pigeon Forge, but a little older/dirtier/cheesy-er. Overall OK, but not someplace most people will want to visit a second time.

Reviews.Title: “Very 'average'...but so is everything in Branson. Not a bad place in total.”
Reviews.Author: MindEddy
Reviews.Content: This was a learning experience. We're those parents who can never pull the trigger on a weekend vacation, so we just did it. We had a good time and learned alot. What we learned about Grand Country Inn: 1) There are no DEALS. Any "package" you buy actually could be reproduced via 'coupon' books located all over town. A package just simply applies the coupons deals for you for events [show, activities, buffet, etc.] at the hotel property itself. 2) The buffet at Grand Country IS likely one of the best for the money, but remember...it will make you ill. IT is a TON of food being rolled out...it ain't clean...but enough sugar, salt, and fat that it is wonderful...and you will be sick later. Families, I recommend paying the $10 [one time] for a room fridge and keeping fruit, bread, milk, cereal...and making the buffet a 'once a day' at most thing. 3) Water park...is small and has VERY LITTLE SEATING...so moms/dads if it is crowded at all it is very tough to get comfortable. Many seats are within "squirting distance" of water guns. Don't get me wrong....it is fun for kids ages 1-12'ish, but it is a cramped environment. Tons of chlorine in water. Prepare. 4) Free coffee and tea! Ok, you must find the silver linings. My wife thought this was the 'bomb', even though I reminded her we did PAY for that. Also, I noticed most didn't ask for proof we were staying at the hotel, so I'm guessing the coffee and tea is something they can afford to give away. sub 4a: ROOMS - decent. Bugs here and there, but service is great. Front desk VERY responsive. TAKE A SMALL FAN [any hotel] for noise...makes sleep so much better. 5) The Amazing Pets show was great. Again, we got it "free" in our package, but did the math later and realized coupons would have given us the same thing if we'd just stayed at the hotel at regular rate. When they say "$100 savings", they use the non-coupon rates. 6) Butterfly Museum - It was really cool....but really not worth the feel. The movie is not a kids movie [they lie] and you'll be bored in about 20 minutes at the museum. Very small and "over-advertised" as more. Staff was really rude and uncaring in general...except for the lady in the "Science Museum" [which actually is a VERY small room with about 20 cages/aquariums. 7) Go carts are expensive but fun. We should have riden the DUCKS. 8) DOWNTOWN - Get there! We discovered it the last day and wish we hadn't. Great area to look at stores, maybe even stay. Cool OLD shops and NEW shops and the "BRANSON CAFE" is the place to eat. Free trolly and cool "splash" launching area for the DUCK boats. [ignore the Tanger Outlet] ME

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time.”
Reviews.Author: Sskbailey03
Reviews.Content: Family of four, 2 girls 8-9. Read the reviews before we went, it was what we expected. The rooms are small somewhat used but it was clean. Staff were helpful and polite. The place was expensive but haven't been to many places that wasn't expensive. The girls had a good time and was on the go from the moment we got there, was not in room much. Thought the splash house could of been a little more, but the girls didn't seem to mind. Took advantage of the free stuff (Show, Pizzas, and putt putt golf). Amazing pets was a fun show. Agree with earlier review that things are a little spread out but in good weather not big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: saha93
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend. All though no major complaints with the place, I can't say it was worth the money. The rooms were small and outdated, but they were clean. The staff was friendly and the lifeguards were great. Our children loved the water park, although I have to say I was expecting more. Several things, buffet, mini golf, arcade, etc were within walking distance, but nothing is connected via an indoor route. The one thing i wasn't expecting was the 5 min plus walk to the water park from our room. Since it was the summer it wasn't an issue, but in the colder months, that would not be ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Parnellfamily
Reviews.Content: This water park is not worth the money!!!! The rooms are horrible & the water park is averagr at best! Hardly nothing to do in there!! Dont waste your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: hrtlndbr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. Walking distance to food and entertainment and that was just on the property. Our 12 year old son loved the pools and arcade area. Our package came with free breakfast buffet and mini golf and coupons for discounts and special offers on the property. Only bad thing, the beds. At first they feel great, but after one night it felt like I had slept on the floor! It was a fun place overall and would recommend to family and friends to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We have found our Repeat-Vacation spot in Branson”
Reviews.Author: bassman4jesus
Reviews.Content: Knowing that we wanted to stay in a Water Park resort in Branson, we selected the Grand Country Inn (vs Castle Rock) because of the more favorable reviews here in Trip Advisor. We were definitely not disappointed; in fact, we were pleasantly surprised how much fun we had staying there. Upon arriving in our hotel room (bldg 3), we were pleased how clean & fresh everything was. The room was nothing special, pretty standard-BUT the beds were super comfortable. They felt like the beds in the Carnival Cruise ships. They were great! We are a family of four with an infant and a 4-yr old little girl, so we love the fact that everything is within easy walking distance. We spent many hours of fun in the indoor water park. The resort had a late night spring party in their Fun Zone "club house" featuring arcades, laser maze, mini-bowling, a ball shooting cage, bumper cars and mini-golf. Buffet was decent but at $13 was a bit over-priced, but you pay for convenience, I guess. There's also another 36-hole indoor miniature golf course. We ran out of weekends and did not get to see their shows (oh well), there will always be another trip. We're definitely coming back to stay at the Grand Country Inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice water park, but the rooms are poor”
Reviews.Author: tdiddyclan
Reviews.Content: On the last night of our Branson vacation the kids wanted to stay here to enjoy the water park, so we dropped in and booked a room for the night. The water park was nice, and the kids really enjoyed it, but when the day was done and we went to our room, well let's just say we weren't impressed. Think the most basic Motel 6 room, that is about 10 years worn out and you get the picture. I am sure these rooms are well worn by families with kids and they look like it. It was clean, but that is about all I can say about it. You are definitely paying for the water park when you stay here. On the positive side, we were allowed to use the water park starting the morning we checked in even though we couldn't get a room until that afternoon. Front desk staff were nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing place ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Heythere135
Reviews.Content: I love the indoor waterpark at this hotel! I've gone to this hotel every year ever since I was 3! It has the best mini golf course awsome food great rooms and it's in the heart of Branson. We always see the comedy jamboree an the amazing pets show while we are there. In the gift shop they have really old toys and things even my dad used to play with when he was a kid! I can't wait to go there this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for Couples!”
Reviews.Author: KaityandJohn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Grand Country for our 1yr anniv. We easily booked our room online with one of the weekend specials GC was offering. When we got to the hotel everyone from the receptionist, waiters, to the maids were very accommodating and friendly! After we settled into a very clean spacious room with a couch, we put on our swim suits and hit the indoor water park! I was worried it would be over populated with kids but the park is so big we had no problems. We enjoyed the lazy river for a while, then we even climbed up the massive water park and went down all the slides again and again! It was a lot of fun! We also LOVED the breakfast buffet as well as the pizza place! We have told all our friends about our stay at Grand Country and would highly recommend it to couples wanting some relaxation and fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: dolphndrmr
Reviews.Content: Our family went for the weekend and had a great time. Our 2 and 3 year olds loved the water park and Amazing Pets show (Olga is a little doll, and we loved Snoopy!). They have asked me the last two mornings if we can go back to the water park. Our 10 y/o loved the arcade (but as mentioned previously it was very expensive) and water park as well. The breakfast buffet was so delicious we ate there both mornings, and I thought it was very affordable! Cheaper than McDonald's! The buffet staff were all friendly and worked their butts off. The pizza was great, too. The elderly lady working the souvenir shop Monday probably needs to retire or learn some people skills, or maybe she was just having a rough day...guess I should be glad my job does not require much interaction with the public. I was impressed that the souvenirs were actually affordable, and I saw the same t-shirts at our local zoo for $4 more than at Grand Country (please don't raise your prices!!). The lady at the candy shop (also affordable) on Saturday and the man working the blacklight golf (very cool) were sweeties and interacted great with our ornery children. I would've liked to spend more time there and take in more shows, but we'll just have to plan another trip! The rooms weren't fancy, but adequate for us. I was worried we would run out of hot water before I got my shower in since it was so crowded, but we didn't! It was nice to find they had free wi-fi in all rooms; however, the signal wasn't strong enough to stream Netflix movies or play XBox Live (which didn't bother me, since I was disappointed they brought that on "vacation" anyways!!). I also wanted to note that we really appreciated them accomodating us by making sure our room was right next door to friends we were meeting from another state. Loved how you could just walk anywhere, also...have to work off that great food somehow! Fun, fun, fun!! Improvements to consider would be kitchenettes in the rooms so we could stay there longer, and maybe child care so the adults can take in a show or some shopping by themselves (although it would take a lot for me to leave my children with strangers, but they might be able to work out a fun play place with friendly staff that have had background checks and child care training, and offer a nanny-cam service or something for the parents' peace of mind). Maybe some family karaoke would be fun.

Reviews.Title: “We had the BEST time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mist2206
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package deal for 2 nights at the hotel, water park included, a show, 2 large pizzas, mini golf and a game pass for $219. It was great! Our kids are 3 and 4 years old and the waterpark had a special area just for little kids that was really nice. The lazy river was fun and they were able to do that too . Our 4 yr old was tall enough to go down the slides and he loved it!! The hot tubs were not too hot that kids could not get in. The rooms were nice and clean. We loved that you could walk everywhere instead of having to take the car. The show we saw was Amazing Pets and it was really cute. The kids loved it too. The pizza was fine. Mini Golf was fun and it was the first time our kids had played it. The $10 game pass doesnt go far as alot of the games cost $2 or more. We ate breakfast at the buffet and it was very good! Saturday was a little crowded but on Sunday most of the people had gone home so we didnt have to share with alot of people. The only snag we had was that when we went to check in at the appropriate time, they told us our room was not ready so we had to wait about an hour to get our room BUT we were able to swim during that time so at least that was nice. Great fun at a great price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for family fun”
Reviews.Author: gypsy3family
Reviews.Content: Just left here after a presidents day stay. Can't beat the value of having a water park on the proerty. We also had a grand time at the pet show and mini golf that was included. Rooms were basic but fine for our family. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: kcdad1
Reviews.Content: Took my kids to the hotel/waterpark for Valentines weekend. Saturday night when we left the water park the sidewalks and parking lot were covered in ice, my daughter fell on the ice and so did several other people. I contacted the front desk and was told, we know we will take care of it in the mornig but nothing we can do tonight. I spoke with the Manager Brenda on Monday, she said I don't think it was cold enough to freeze, well sorry your daughter fell nothing we can do but please come back and see us. The lifeguards listen to ipods and text instead of watching what is going on in the water. Save your money and go someplace else, the rooms are old and would rent for about $28 if not for the water park. This place does not care about the customer only the money!

Reviews.Title: “BRRRRRRRRRRR!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kathycross
Reviews.Content: We spent $60 for the four of us to go to the indoor waterpark. There were people wearing heavy coats in there. We floated around the lazy river one time, got dressed and went back up to the front desk and asked for our money back(which they gave us without any arguement). We then went back to our own hotel and played for free in our nice warm indoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for the dates and ameneties”
Reviews.Author: kansasokie
Reviews.Content: Our family (which included 3 preteens) booked 3 rooms over Christmas at the Grand Country Inn primarily because of the water park. Though the park wasn't the best, the kids had fun there. However the price for the rooms was decidely high for the condition of the rooms -- clean, but very basic and somewhat threadbare-- and the lack of ameneties -- no refrigerator, no microwave and no fitness room. The other sections of the Grand Country complex were convenient and we had good experiences in all of them. Considering the off season, the room rates should have been significantly adjusted.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Arktrav59
Reviews.Content: We are Branson regulars and generally stay at the Radisson or the Hilton. This time the kids begged for the indoor water park at Grand Country. So for $10 MORE I got two rooms at the Grand Country instead of the Hilton solely for the waterpark. The waterpark was more than adequate and no complaints. The room was a disaster. All of the complaints you read on here are true about beds, outdated fixtures, everything. Even the 9 year old complained about how scratchy the towels are, and he doesn't even think about towels. And when we arrived, I heard one desk clerk say there was 44% occupancy. And they tried to put us in a building that was at least 5 city blocks away from the swimming pool. I complained to the manager and got that fixed. I could understand if the hotel had been full. But it was a ghost town, so why not treat guests as if their return business mattered to you? My biggest complaint is this. We stayed in this 2 star at best hotel solely for the water park. Only after we arrived did we learn that the water park does not open until 2:00 in the afternoon. Checkout time is 11:00 am. I think you'll find that particular fact does not exist on the website. So with a one night stay, and two rooms, I paid a couple of hundred dollars for two hours at the pool. I told the desk clerk (the snippy one, not the nice one) to tell the manager to enjoy my $200. They won't be seeing me again.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities...rooms needs updating”
Reviews.Author: funlover2010
Reviews.Content: We spent a lot of time at the indoor water park which was nice and clean. Our son loved the arcade and indoor mini golf. The food at the buffet tasted great although it was somewhat pricey. The rooms leave something to be desired. The carpet is stained. Just like someone else stated, they do not use a fitted sheet on the mattress. That's kind of gross because you could possibly end up sleeping on the mattress itself. Fitted sheets can't cost that much money. It appeared as though there were coffee grounds on the bathroom counter. Upon further inspection, I realized that the brown stuff was falling from the lights above. I think this is due to the fact that the ventilation is substandard in the room. Every time we would walk in, the room would feel humid and smell musty. There is no fan in the bathroom either. You can hear people walking up the stairs, talking, and running water in the adjacent rooms. The mattress was very uncomfortable to me, especially since I'm five months pregnant. The amenities made up for the average room for us since we have a 10 year old. The hotel rooms would benefit from major updating and would make this a better place to stay overall. I would not say in this hotel again if I did not have a young child. I would not recommend this place to anyone who wouldn't benefit from the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation to take grandchildren”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnn97
Reviews.Content: We took our four grandchildren here for their annual vacation with us and wow what a fantastic choice and wonderful time. The hotel immediately responded to our requests no mater what they were and made us feel welcome and valued customer. The smaller children enjoyed the water park and the older two the park as well as the pools. The rooms were nice and clean and all the attractions wonderful. Keep up the good work. Several of our friends booked trips there after we came back with the good news of a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Payj4412
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I got a little worried. But when we got there the staff was really nice. We checked in gave us our keys not the stupid cards that u get now. We made our way to the rooms. They we very clean the air was on and it was comfortable in the room. Room service was quick and brought our towels. The buffet was clean and fresh. The pizza place was also. My two girls 7 and 13 had a blast. Best part was the indoor water park. We had so much fun. The girls didn't want to leave. I too had fun. So far I have told all our friends and family. Also my daughter left her cell phone charger and the mailed it to us. I would return with no worries. I don't know about the bad reviews because I have nothing but good things to say about our stay with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Pass Up The Opportunity!”
Reviews.Author: southernqueen20
Reviews.Content: Grand Country Inn offered a Summer Family Package on their website and we were planning a trip to Branson anyways, so I did some figuring and even with our free hotel night (certificate someone gave us) we couldn't pass up the deal! So, we chose to stay at Grand Country Inn for the first time with my nephew and niece (ages 10 and 8) We love the shows at Grand Country Music Hall, and even when it's just my husband and I going to Branson, it is just mandatory that he take me to the Fun Spot, also on the premises. The package included two nights stay at the hotel, free water park passes, tickets to one of their shows, 2 large pizzas and a round of black light mini golf. I was wondering how the hotel rooms would be, honestly I assumed they were cheap, since they had so many, and I've heard lots of things about the hotel and water park area, so I had my questions. We arrived and checked in without a problem. Stayed in a building farther away from the water park (which was not a big deal!) and got settled into our room. It was super clean!! I was shocked.. I called my parents (also in Branson at another hotel) to tell him how clean our room was! We headed to the water park soon after, and the temperature was just right! I was expecting a humid miserable time, but I had a blast! Oh, and the children did also. One problem, actually the only problem that I had, was at the water park in the lazy river. I guess some people do not know why it is called the Lazy River because there was pushing and shoving and running by a bunch of teenagers. Finally I got tired of it and got out, as well as some other people, so the lifeguard asked the troublemakers to leave the area. The small water park area outside was nice, more for younger children. There were several pools and hot tubs on the premises, which we all wanted to try out, and did! The show was excellent, as always, and I can't wait to go back again. The pizza's were so great! We had never ate there before, but, we will be back! Of course the black light mini golf was a blast, as well as the fun spot. Our main problem.. we didn't have enough time to do everything we wanted to do as much as we wanted to do it!! While we were taking a break in our hotel room, we heard someone outside vacuuming our AC vents, I was so impressed. Again, this is one of the cleanest, and nicest staffed hotels I've stayed at, and I cannot wait to go back again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Indoor waterpark is GROSS!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimcara4
Reviews.Content: Value was O.K. Hotel is outdated and cheap. Service was poor, unfriendly and uncaring. Outdoor waterpark was very nice for little kids. Outdoor pools were very clean and well kept. DONT go for the indoor water park!! It is absolutely without a doubt disgusting. I couldn't wait to get my 2 small kids out of there. Bathrooms overflowing with poop and pee. Greenish brown crustyness all over the kiddy area and lazy river. Indoor treehouse rusted allover and not good for little ones. Just filthy, cloudy water GROSS. If you plan on just staying outside its OK. Inside is Garbage, and i am truly not kidding! Also the Chlorine is so strong our eyes are still red and we have been home for 9 hours. I wish we would have found another place to stay! Take my advice and spend your hard earned money somewhere better

Reviews.Title: “a little over rated”
Reviews.Author: mammawith3
Reviews.Content: I looked at lots of reviews for several days before we went on our trip to Branson. I was looking for good deals, coupons and good places that were worth going to. I didn't even think to look at reviews for the Grand Country it just seemed really good but I guess I should have. I got on the web site and they had a deal going on til Aug 14 for 2 night and 3 days for 268. plus tax. That got you the splash country, a free show at their facility, 2 free pizzas, free game of black light mini golf. The water park was pretty good. The chlorine at the the inside waterpark was very strong, I got a head cold after we had been there a little while and it didn't really get better until the day we were leaving. The pizza wasn't bad. The arcade was way too expensive. They had like jungle gym areas for kids to play in but you had to pay for 3 dollars per kid on top of money for every game. We really enjoyed the black light mini golf the kids really enjoyed it but we didn't have to pay for it. We called to the desk for a couple more pillows and after 20 of 30 minutes my husband called again and asked if we needed to go get them and they brought them up after 15 minutes or so. Each bed had 2 fairly flat pillows. I didn't notice it being dirty but it wasn't anything very impressive. I guess the water park is suppose to make up for the 120. you pay a night. We decided to stay a third night and they wouldn't give us any kind of deal. So we went to the Ramada and payed 70.00 and it was a much nicer room it had a hida couch and 4 full pillows on each bed. It had a very nice shower, a luggage carrier with wheels and an elevator. It had 2 pools, and an outside jungle gym area. It wasn't perfect but it was deffinately better. We went to the Amazing Pets show at the Grand Country which we got for free and it was really good. I bought the DVD of it during intermission for 15.00 and tried to play it today and it won't work, not very happy about that. Overall I would say they Grand Country is over rated. We won't stay there again. I would recommend going to a nice hotel with a pool that is cheaper it will probably be just as good if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel declining - don't stay”
Reviews.Author: CQ99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Country Inn in Branson, Missouri, the first weekend in August, 2010. I strongly believe that this is a hotel on the decline. To be fair, the deal we purchased was totally fulfilled by the Inn and the staff was friendly. When we called for more towels during the evening, they came in just a few minutes. However, hygiene and concern for customers was lacking. Much to my dismay, I realized that the bottom sheets on the two beds in our room were not fitted sheets. And, I found this by having my feet rubbing the cover on the mattress. The same cover that every other customer rubs their dirty feet on. The sheets were about 12 inches shy of meeting the end of the bed. When I asked the Front Desk about it, they asked the cleaning staff to check it out - and they reported that I was wrong and that all was well. So, I took pictures. I took the pictures back up to the front where the Head of the cleaning staff said she was sorry about that but they don't have any fitted sheets and this is the way they make the beds. And, she said that there is nothing they can do about it. I hadn't asked for anything but had hoped for some level of concern. The other big issue that came up was that the rest of the rooms on our hall were up late into the night and felt that the hallway was their shouting area. While this is not the fault of the Inn, after four separate calls to them, they never got the other guests to hold it down. This lasted until about 2:45 in the morning and while the Front Desk apologized in the morning about it and initially said they would compensate us by giving us some discounts on the buffet that they have. They later said that the Owner decided against this and there was nothing that they could do about it. Now, lets talk about the Water Park. While the park was fine, nobody checked people coming in or leaving the park and inside the building were a couple open doors which kids could easily leave (voluntarily or not). The sad thing is that there was a booth that had obviously been maintained at one point but clearly had not in a long time. Sadly, once the experience goes bad, you start noticing more issues - like how the shower head screamed when water was on and how the hair dryer overheated. I would recommend that you think twice about staying at Grand Country Inn because it is obviously not what it once was.

Reviews.Title: “We have a toddler and a teenager, this hotel was a good mix for both”
Reviews.Author: drclsummer
Reviews.Content: I was pretty concerned when I read the comments. It seems that many of the people that commented are used to higher end hotels. There are times that my husband and I stay in the fancier hotels, but as a family this is more the way it is. No, there is not a fridge, or a microwave in the room. The beds however, were comfortable and the room was clean. You do need to be aware that you may have a walk to the water park. This was not that big of a deal for us. Our room was located in the building furthest from the water park and the temps during our stay were at or near 100 degrees but, we are able and not afraid of walking. Over-all, we were pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “We were robbed!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: musicmaker55
Reviews.Content: Of course , we have read the signs many times to NOT leave $$$ and valuables in the room, but we were in a hurry and headed off to the waterpark and forgot to pick up our wallets.....Someone went in our room and relieved us of over $700 cash, Thank goodness they did not take our credit cards or any of our other stuff--- The manager basically called my husband a liar and did not offer to even investigate. She said "nothing" like that had EVER happened, but one of the employees told us (in private) that we WERE NOT the first ones!!!! My husband tried to explain that we DID NOT expect to get our $$$$ back, but we just wanted them to know they might have a problem...The manager did not even say that she was sorry that this had happened.....We will never stay anywhere that still uses regular keys...Obviously, SOMEONE has a key to the room we stayed in!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: 80Jac
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel prior to reading any reivews. When I began reading them I really started to get worried since they are mainly negative. Maybe I am just simple, but I thought the stay was quite nice and well worth the money. I felt the positives outweighted any negatives. The front desk clerks were very nice, the rooms were very clean and my kids had a wonderful time at the waterpark. Everything was very safe and somewhat convenient if you don't mind walking a bit. We were placed in building 3 which was at the other end of the property so I drove so that we wouldn't have to walk back in the dark. The rooms do need updating and the pillows are rather flat. It was also odd that you get an actual key for your room, but that may be normal for an Inn type setup. This was my first time to stay at an outside cooridor property. We had dinner at the Papa Grands Pizza and the buffet was really good...its attached to the fun spot so you can eat and then play in the arcade if you choose. All in all it was a great stay and we will probably either come back to stay again or at the very least by a day pass to enjoy the water park.

Reviews.Title: “OK for first trip to Branson, but will not stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mandcgoins
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Grand Contry Inn if you have four or less people. We have three girls, the oldest is 18. We bought the Platnium Package, but we had to pay $107 extra for an extra adult. However, that $107 did not include her a place to sleep. We had to pay an additional $27 for her to sleep in the room. And, we were not informed of that until we checked into the room. The Package we purchased was a bargain; we received 5 tickets for two days to Silver Dollar City, free putt-putt golf, and tickets for the whole family for one show of our choosing. As for the staff, they were not friendly or helpful. Our request for additional towels was continually ignored. But, we spent most of our time away from the hotel, so it ended up becoming a very enjoyable trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's OK.”
Reviews.Author: jeninok
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't great, but wasn't horrible either. Our room was clean and cool when we checked in. The rooms aren't anything to rave about. Decor is dated, but adequate. Our first night, the main play thing in the indoor water park was closed. The second day, the lazy river was closed. This was a bummer for my daughter. We decided to eat breakfast at the buffett. Whoa! Be prepared to spend a small fortune. For 2 adults and 1 child it was $30 to eat. Granted there was a large selection, but personally I think that's pricey for breakfast. Our room was in building 3, which was quiet, but is at the opposite end from the water park. I was shocked that the room keys are actually keys. I was expecting cards. I think for our next trip to Branson, we probably stay somwhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little extra money and stay someplace else.”
Reviews.Author: bic31
Reviews.Content: I purchased this through a package deal with Silver Dollar City. That was my first mistake. This is a motel with all outside access. The rooms were small and the bathroom even smaller. The rooms need to be updated. Thank goodness they were clean. When we went out for the day we put a do not disturb sign on the door so they would not clean. When we returned we noticed that the trash had been emptied. Not happy that they had gone in. And that was all they did--did not make beds or give clean towels since they were there. There are three buildings on the property. expect to either walk outside or drive to the waterpark. The waterpark was small, and not really a waterpark. Other comments mention it is terrible, they are right. The hot tub was really hot and there were not many places to sit and watch the kids. If you have ever stayed at a Great Wolf Lodge, this is nothing like it, not even close. The second thing I learned is if I go to Branson again we will stay at a chain hotel ,ie, Best Western, etc.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE. We will NEVER go back.”
Reviews.Author: KansasFamilyman
Reviews.Content: I wish we had taken the time to read the reviews before making our reservation for the Grand Country Inn. DO NOT STAY HERE! Check in was 3PM, which we thought was odd, since Check out is 11AM. The staff at the front desk was not rude, but not friendly either. The rooms have old fashion keys, which I find dangerous in this day and age. They don't even stamp DO NOT COPY on them. I could have taken it to Wal Mart and made copies and gone back after checkout and robbed the next people blind. I would be surprised if this doesn't happen. The room was okay. Nothing special, but clean for the most part. No fridge or microwave. The only problem was that we were in building 3, which is a LONG ways from the water park and lobby. Trust me, I had to walk it at 4AM (more on that later). The water park is a joke . Too many rooms + very small water park = very CROWDED water park. If you are expecting it to be on par with the Great Wolf Lodge, you will be dissapointed. We stayed about 20 minutes and then got sick of kids crashing into us or pushing ahead of us on the lazy river.. it was packed like sardines. And, the pool by our room was closed for maintenance, and the only other one was clear across the complex. The Pizza place was not good. We ate it because we had a special that gave us two pizzas as part of our deal, but it was not good. We played the black light mini golf, and it was pretty neat. The holes are really simple, and the repetative music and speaking coming out of the loud speakers gets really old, really fast. BUT HERE IS THE HORRIBLE PART... on the second and last night of our stay, I heard a very loud thump or bang, as if someone hit the wall at a run. Then I began to smell freon and realized it was getting hotter in the room. The Air conditioner had blown up. This happened at 4 AM. I walked to the office and told them what happened. After much discussion, they gave me the keys to a different room, and I moved all of our stuff and then our kids to the new room. By the time we were able to go back to bed it was 5 AM. Then, when we got around about 9 or so, My wife showered and was getting ready in front of the mirror while I was in the shower. WITHOUT WARNING, the door opens, and there were two people standing in the doorway staring at my wife who was wearing only a small towel. They said something and left. My wife was STEAMED! She called the front desk and complained, and was told it was probably the cleaning staff. She asked them if the cleaning staff were in the habit of walking into rooms without knocking, and told them to have a talk with their staff about not doing so in the future. Between the relocation in the middle of the night, and being walked in on by staff, we felt we deserved to have the second night comped. We spent a lot of money in the restaurant (food was so-so, but the staff was very friendly... they are working for tips after all) and the arcade, and felt they should reimburse us for the one night. The lady who was the supervisor said only the owner could make that decision, and said she would call us on our cell phone in a few hours. We got a call from her later that day saying the owner would take $30 off the bill. My wife, who has her degree in hotel and restaurant management, and is the executive director of a large retirement community, told them that that was not acceptable. We asked that one night's hotel stay be reimbursed. That was 4 days ago, and we have heard nothing further from them. We checked our account last night, and not even the $30 had been reimbursed. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience and fun splash area”
Reviews.Author: mammtek
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was very worried about staying here. Upon check-in, the front office staff was very plesant and informative. Our room was bigger than most hotels we stay in for athletic events. Although the rooms are older and they could definately use new beds, the room was clean and there were extra towels and washclothes. Our room was cleaned daily. We enjoyed the indoor mini golf and the splash park. I didnt expect a big splash area so when I saw how large it was I was impressed. It was difficult to get in and out of the parking lot during peak traffic times, but that is to be expected staying on HWY 76. The shows are good and the breakfast buffet is better than the free ones you get when you stay somewhere with a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not too Expensive, Lots for Kids”
Reviews.Author: RCF30
Reviews.Content: After reading the reveiws on here, I was expecting a horrible experience. I was happy that most of the negative reviews are full of hot air. Not sure what happened during spring break of this year (most of the bad reviews are from March, when a lot of MO is on spring break) but we had a great stay. The hotel was not busy, the nights were quiet even with the music hall packed out for shows. We got in building 1 without having to pay for it. Rooms: Room was clean and ready when we arrived. Room was cleaned every day by early afternoon. Plenty of hot water. Coffee maker, ironing board, and hairdryer are only amenities. Fridge can be rented. Hangers provided as well as plenty of dresser drawer space. Entertainment: We saw the Amazing Pets show and it was cute. I wouldn't say it was great, but it had it's fun moments for kids and adults. My kids absolutely loved the Fun Spot and pizza buffet. In fact, they both wanted to make it back to the hotel in time to play games each night at the fun spot. The arcade is not expensive. You preload money onto a card and the games range from .25 to $2 depending on how easy it is to win. Games give lots of tickets. We won 250 tickets from one game and both kids won well over 1000 tickets total. You can keep your tickets on your card and just keep reloading until you leave and then pick prizes. There are two indoor golf areas. Mine liked the blacklight course. Food: The pizza was okay. They have 6.99 coupons but that's the regular price anyway so not sure what the coupon's for. We ate twice at the Grand Buffet for breakfast and they have plenty of selection. We actually hit the breakfast late one day and got to sample lunch, but I'd say stick with the breakfast buffet for the best food. Didn't care for the fudge from the candy shop. Waterpark: Considering this is a hotel, this can absolutely be called a waterpark. There is a lazy river, two hot tubs, two slides, a big spill bucket, plus plenty to climb and play on and a basketball pool. Even with the toddler area closed for the season, my kids had a blast at the indoor park. There is also an indoor pool and hot tub in building 2 along with an outdoor pool next to the waterpark. The park was clean, fresh towels, not too crowded. The chlorine is a little strong, but it's like that anywhere in an inside swim environment. Cons: Hot tubs should be called lukewarm tubs. They are not hot at all. We tried all the hottubs on the premises and none are kept hot. Our shower hardly drained and by the end of your shower you were standing in calf high water. We enjoyed our stay at Grand Country and would go again. Not sure how they are when they're fully booked, but for our trip we thought it was well worth the $$

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel--but not worth the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: whatawhata
Reviews.Content: I come to Branson at least once a year. This is the first year I stayed at Grand Country. I traveled with a 2 yr old, 6 yr old, & a 11 year old. The rooms were not great, but okay. We did the Spring Break package. The waterpark---how can you really call this a waterpark??? The toddler area was okay--2 slides a little rocking frog and a turtle that they can climb on (whic is extremly dangerous) My two yr old enjoyed it for 2o minutes than got bored. The lazy river was okay if the kids in it weren't acting crazy! & the slides were okay the first go around. Went to the Grand Country Inn for breakfast (where they overcharged me-two year old was supposed to be free & they charged me for a child) NOTHING was good except maybe a piece of bacon. Went to the Amazing Pets show--the only person that enjoyed it was the 11 year old who is a major cat lover. (the people who are on the brochure are not even in the show anymore--which makes me wonder if someone else took it over??? Frankie the monkey was not even present) Pizza from the pizza place was pretty good, not great like dominoes or pizza hut sorta like a good frozen pizza. We ended up eating there twice. walked around the arcade game area while we waited on the pizza it wasn't worth coming back to we didn't even play the black light golf which was with our package deal because it looked boring even to the kids. Overall I would say this is an okay place to stay, but definatly not worth the price. In my opionion it would be better to stay at a cheaper hotel with an indoor pool, & have extra money to do other things. (go carts, dinosaur museum, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “THe good the Bad AND THE UGLY!”
Reviews.Author: JBP12
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good as it won't take very long: The waterpark. If you have kids between 5 and 12 they will have a blast. The buffet. For the price, it's really not that bad. Props to the pastry chef. The indoor golf is convenient and fun. Shows - the pet one was funny - again if your kid is between 5 and 12. The Bad: The waterpark rarely had any clean towels and the water was somewhat cold. There is enough chlorine in the hot tub to make your eyes burn while you just sit near it. Wear water shoes because you won't want to get near the bathrooms without them. The arcade is overpriced but that is to be expected. THE UGLY: Couldn't check in until 4:30 because they were "short staff" (seems to be everyday) Room reeked of smoke. And I mean REEKED. After complaining we were told we were in the "non-smoking wing" (Bldg1). Must have gone to non-smoking the day we checked in. Your room won't be cleaned until 4 or 5 PM - if at all. Since you pay up front, they are only interested in cleaning rooms for the new arrivals. Stayovers are ignored. You have to pester to get someone to clean your room. The one day they did clean the room, they folded the towels we had on the floor and put them back up (I know this because I cut myself shaving and clearly the towel I had used was back up on the rack.....) Rooms are pretty dirty with all the people coming and going from the wet waterpark and dirty parking lot. Lord knows the last time the carpet saw some shampoo. We had the kids quarantined to the beds so they wouldn't touch the floor. Hot water would be gone if you weren't up before 8:30. Best bet is to stay somewhere nice and take the kids to the waterpark as a side venture..

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience. Poor Service. WaterPark Over Crowded”
Reviews.Author: georgiaridge
Reviews.Content: Checked in with my husband, 9 y/o, our older daughter and her husband. We are frequent visitors to Branson, so we were very well aware that this would be an extremely busy weekend for the area. Check in time was 3, but we were asked to return at 4:30 due to being so busy. Since I am a frequent traveler, I accustomed to giving my credit card and settling up at the the end of my stay..I perferred to pay cash at the end of my stay. This was not allowed. I had to pay in full upon arrival. The hotel room was fairly clean though is in need of new carpet and upolstery(they both looked a little dirty). Out of the 4 nights we stayed our froom was not cleaned twice. We had to complain and we were brought clean towels. Our bed linens were not changed at all during our stay. The walls and ceiling apparently do not have appropriate noise buffers because were were kept awake every night by the pitter-patter of feet and a bouncing ball above us. We did complain at the desk regarding the noise level they said they would address the noise...but there is not much they can do about the real problem There was a problem with the water heater and we had to take a very luke warm showers a couple of times. The water park is great fun for the kids even though it is located outside the hotel, but was overcrowded. It is not just for hotel patrons. Locals can come and use the park for $5.00 (i overheard this price quoted) 2 different days we were there 2 bus loads of kids not staying at the hotel using the water park. Parking is a huge issue if you are staying near the waterpark. People from whereever, used the parking spaces in front of our rooms forcing us to park on the other side of the hotel. The food at the resturant on the property was gross and over priced!.When we addressed the issues with the management at the front desk we were told they could do nothing for us, that the Owners would have to call us after our stay. We will see..All our issues could have been easily resolved with management, but apparently no one on duty has any authority to hanldle issues of concern. Even though is a nice recreation place for children I think we will stay at the competition, which is slightly higher in price and is a newly renovated hotel with the waterpark located on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Water Park a joke for winter and Office staff has POOR attitudes!”
Reviews.Author: wrinkles-momma
Reviews.Content: While staying at this hotel my wife and I took our girls on our FIRST family vacation. Thinking that this would be a good place to stay with two young children we chose Grand Country Inn. The water park is indoors and is supposed to be warm... NOT!!!!! We talked to the life guard and he said that their heat has been broke for over a year and that no one can figure out what is wrong with it. Our two little girls couldnt even stay in the water. We went to the front desk and complained and they said that they could not even give us our money back for that night. So we had to stay there with nothing to do even though we had to pay in the price for the water park. They could have gave us our money back so we could go stay somewhere else so the kids could have had a good time. So if you are going here to ENJOY the water park even tho it is cold outside I would stay somewhere else!!!!!! Castle rock might be a tad bit higher in price but it is SOOOOO much NICER in all ways!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We ended up having to stay another night because of the snow and ice storm that came in and that is where we went. And we will definately go back there!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OUR FAMILY WOULD NEVER STAY AT GRAND COUNTRY INN AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: adlove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have 4 children aging from pre teen to infant. When we arrived at the hotel at 3pm which is check in time the room wasn't ready. They said it should be ready in 30 minutes. When we checked back in 30 minutes later, the room still wasn't ready. It wasn't ready till 4:30. The rooms were clean and smelled really good but very small with no microwave or refrigators. The water park was OK. Not really much for the older kids to do. The baby area had swings but under the swings had a rough surface which cut my babys toes. The waterpark isn't even in the hotel. So in the winter or cool weather your kids will freeze leaving the water park. They didn't have a place to change your clothes only in restroom stalls. My family would not ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok.....would only stay there if planning to visit the waterpark.”
Reviews.Author: 123lets_go456
Reviews.Content: Likes: clean room, great location in Branson, lots for kids to do all within walking distance, waterpark is included with the price of the hotel room Dislikes: the hotel is not attached to the waterpark and our room was on the opposite side of the complex so it was a long walk in the cold (especially if you are wet!), the bathroom is very small (could hardly even turn around or get dressed in the bathroom), breakfast is not included Recommendations: request a room as close to the waterpark as possible. The waterpark is ok, but probably more for children ages 3 - 12. Nothing for the bigger kids to do. We had thought we would spend the entire day at the waterpark but our kids were ready to leave after about 2 hours. The water was so cold and it made it difficult to enjoy the slides because it was so cold. We personally would not choose this hotel if we were not planning on going to the waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “Gonna go again.”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaFamilyof4
Reviews.Content: My family went over Spring Break and the inn was full with the no vacancy sign on. I was a little nervous that the waterpark was going to be a mad house. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the park was not at all over crowded, full but definetly not crowded. My 2 year old had a blast and my 8 year old can't wait to go back. The rooms are not a five star, but they are clean. Front desk service and house keeping were solid. Pay the $10 for the close room if possble but don't let that bother you if you can't. The good times my kids had and the smiles on their faces makes this place great. We will definetly go back and would recommend you give it a try. Sure beats the price of Great Wolf Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: RachelMae77
Reviews.Content: The room was small and way over priced! After a long day of travel and a visit to Silver Dollar City, we were ready for bed. Until we pulled the comforter back and our sheets were dirty and there was hair all over the bedding. Yuck, we complained to the front desk and checked out of the hotel. They still charged our credit card for the full time we were suppose to stay. After a lenghty dispute with the credit card company and Grand Country Inn we only paid for the hour we stayed! This is a awful place!

Reviews.Title: “Don't belive all the negative reviews. This a very nice hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: JMOOREEllsinore
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews after booking this hotel for a cheerleading team of 25. I became worried about some of the bad reviews people had wrote. Luckly I had nothing to worry about. This hotel is perfectly fine for anybody needed a place to stay. While it did have some draw backs it is nothing that cant be fixed. PROS: Location is perfect!! right on the strip. ~ Rooms are basic with no frills but you did not pay for frills here ~ Water Park is very big and the children loved it. ~ Good parking to get to your room ~ CONS: No breakfast of anykind, had to go the the Grand Country Buffett wich for a family of 4 cost around $32.00. ~ No Wi Fi not really that big a deal but it could be for some people. ~ The Chlorine that burns your eyes and nose hours after being in the waterpark, granted it is indoors and it has no place to go but it is very strong. All in all a nice place to stay, I would recommend it to anybody seeking a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for the kids”
Reviews.Author: bizifam6
Reviews.Content: 1st off I did and would do again if we ever decide to stay here again pay the extra $10.00 a night to stay in building one. Otherwise your gonna have a nice walk over to the waterpark which would not be fun in the cold or with little ones. Very upset that they didnt have the parking lot plowed the day after the snow strom when the sun was out and it was all melting would have been perfect. Due to their not doing that my mother in law fell in the parking lot on black ice and was hurt. They said they were sorry and that they would let the owner know. I guess they had several other complaints from other guests too. But owner refused to have it taken care of. The rooms that we had were clean nothing special, I was not disaponted. If you want a fridge in the room it was a $11.00 charge for the whole stay they brought it to our room. The water park was COLD! So not so fun for the older people . But the kids didnt seem to mind. The staff were friendly for the most part. The people that worked at the food buffet were awsome. Very friendly! The breakfast and the dinner food is good. Not so sure it was worth $13.00 a person for the dinner.But good.

Reviews.Title: “Good family get away!”
Reviews.Author: jrmcgriff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Country inn November 12-14th. Our room was clean, maybe a tad outdated but the beds were comfy the mattresses looked new. We paid the $10 fee to be in the building next to the water park and it was well worth it. Only bad thing was the water park did not open until 2pm on Friday. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Replace the Staff”
Reviews.Author: davusmc
Reviews.Content: With the way the economy is today, I would think the owners of the Grand Country Inn would like to keep customers. We found the Staff was rude, had bad attitudes and not willing to help. I had to call four times before I could get the sheets changed after we checked in and found the room still dirty. As far as the Water Park, they need to drastically clean it and update the facilities. There are to may other option in Branson for anyone to put up with the total lack of customer service. One good note the Buffet staff was very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: spor8
Reviews.Content: Our group stayed at the Inn for 4 nights and saw the show. The Inn was clean, the staff most cooperative and the continental breakfast was very good. We loved the show , the gift shops and the entire atmosphere. I would highly recommend the Inn and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't stay again...”
Reviews.Author: mamabear98
Reviews.Content: The only way to go to stay at this hotel with with the package deal. It cost $617 for 3 nights, 4 tickets to Silver Dollar City, 4 to Amazing pet show, 4 to breakfeast buffet for 2 days, and mini golf. The waterpark was disappointing....we have stayed at Great Wolf Lodge so my 10 year old was bored. It is small and the lifegaurds seem like they don't care. The indoor pool in a whole other building is very small too. The water park is across the parking lot so I feel bad for people in the winter!!!! The rooms are basically like Econo lodge. The bed was comfy and the shower was good. It was very small and feet turned black when walking on carpet too long. They used way too much deoderizer every morning when they cleaned the room....wondered what they were trying to cover up? BUT the breakfast buffet was delicious with great service. The Amazing Pet Show was like nothing I have ever seen...awesome!!! The mini golf is boring and too easy. The pizza and ice cream are both delicious and handy to walk to since the hotel is on the strip. The arcade is nice but my kids spent $20 in about 15 minutes. So there are positives and negatives but next time we will stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lovetovacation97
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful few nights staying at Grand Country Inn!! The room was VERY clean and the staff was friendly. The indoor water park was fun for my kids, as well as the pools. Its right on the strip in Branson and close to lots of entertainment. We ate at the Grand Country buffet and it was great. The service at the restarant wasn't all that great though. We also ate at the pizza buffet there and it was wonderful. They have shows in the Hall. We went to the Amazing Pets, which was fun and entertaining. The glow in dark mini golf was a great value compaired to others in town. We will definatly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trvl2000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at this hotel. I read the reviews before hand and prepared myself for the worst. The reviews are very accurate about this place. Customer service is AWFUL! The rooms are okay, dated but clean. The indoor waterpark is okay. A lot of the water toys were broken or in need of major repair. Small but okay since our kids are young. The pizza buffet was good and cheep-we ate dinner there all 3 nights. The hotel staff along w/the rest of the town has an attitude of 'if you don't like it, leave' which is disappointing considering that this destination is geared towards families. We're not in any hurry to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun...great for kids!!”
Reviews.Author: SouthMississippian
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Country. We got a room in the building next to the indoor water park. We had joined their free Platinum Club on a previous visit because you save money on the room, Grand Buffet, shows at their auditorium and get preference for a room near the water park. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The shower/tub and toilet are in a SMALL separate room from the sink. There is no elevator so if you have a hard time climbing stairs you need to request a room on the first floor. I did not think about that but we did fine. The doors open up to the outside but the area is very safe so that is no problem for my family there. The staff were very nice and check in was easy. We had reservations for the room. The water park was great. It was clean and there were life guards. The hotel has added a new arcade where the pizza buffet is so there is plenty to entertain the kids. The food at the Grand Buffet was great. We also ate at the pizza buffet and at the small grill at the water park and the food was good at both.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: clong74
Reviews.Content: We traveled over the 4th of July holiday with three boys ages 4-6. The room was about what I expected. Nothing fancy, but it was clean and comfortable. The waterpark was a nice size. It was big enough that the kids didn't get bored, and it was small enough that you could keep track of where everyone was at. Our room was on the other side of the complex from the pool, so we had to walk there thru the parking lot, which caused some concern. Once in the waterpark, the boys had a blast. The two youngest were not allowed on the really fun waterslides indoors, so they had more fun on the slides at the outdoor pool. On the second day, the person manning the indoor slides had no problem letting the little ones on the slides and they ended up having a blast. It just depends on which lifeguard is watching them. A few of the lifeguards were over the top protective. Our boys got in trouble for "running in the water". I realize it's their job to help protect, but every kid was running in the water outdoors. Never the less, all in all it was a very enjoyable experience and I would recommend it for families with children of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER stay here! A complete nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: burnsfamily123
Reviews.Content: This was my vacation from hell! We arrived and checked in at 4:30. We went to our tiny room, got our bathing suits on and headed to the water park by 5:00. When we got back to our room at 5:45 my husband asked where I had put his money. He had $80 on the dresser. We searched the room. I went to my purse and discovered that ALL of our vacation money($700) was missing out of my wallet. My husband immediatly called the front desk and they said to call the police. The police came and I filled out police report while he went to talk to front desk. The Grand Country would not cooperate with the officer. They would not turn over a log of the employees that were working at the time to be interviewed. We told them that that was all of our money. We didn't even have money to get back home. Some lady named Lacey pretty much said it is not her problem. It was not a big deal to them at all. We told them that we would be leaving then and they told us that we would still be charged for half a day! When we left for the waterpark that day our room door was shut and locked. An employee of this motel got a key and came into our room. The girl that checked us in was in on this scam because she saw my wallet and my money in it. Nothing else was taken from the room. I had $25 at the bottom of my purse and it was still there. And my sister had money in her wallet in her purse and it was still there. Grand Country has no security cameras and no safes to put your valuables in. Our bolt lock did not even work. Please do not take a chance at this place. Grand Country Inn ruined our family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay”
Reviews.Author: familyofsix2009
Reviews.Content: We just got back and did the platnium package which was a really good deal so for the price it was well worth it. Our kids are 14, 11, 9 and 7 and they all loved the water park. After the 2nd day my oldest two did get bored with it but we stayed busy with everything else they didn't even have time to go back after the second time. Since we did a lot I will break it down: The Hotel Room: very simple, nothing fancy and not worth what they charge buItt was worth what we payed for the package deal. It was clean and cleaned everyday we were there just an OK room. The waterpark: kids loved being able to go and get wet but it is geared for younger kids although my older kids loved it too. It is older so it doesn't look pretty and always a lot of kids around, anytime you have a lot of kids in one place there will be messes. Indoors was too hot just to sit there, ok if you were wet outdoors was for the little kids, mine didn't like the outdoor because it was just too small for them but it looked better and was cooler! Fun spot: kids loved it, spent too much money in there but it was fun, new and kids loved the games. Theatre: the comedy show was ok, not that funny. My kids didn't get most of the jokes although my husband and I did but they were lame. The Amazing pets was much better. Staff: there were a lot of foreign staff who did not understand you but the american staff were all very helpful and friendly! We enjoyed the American staff! Overall, it is an ok place to stay just older and needs updating. You get a really good deal and lots to do when you get the platnium package. If you are looking for better, updated rooms I wouldn't stay here. If you do not have kids I wouldn't stay here. After we got back home we had a magazine in our mailbox and which showed two other waterpark type hotels that we did not know about. Both of these are more expensive but look a lot nicer so I would check them all out before deciding! www.welkbranson.com and www.castlerockbranson.com

Reviews.Title: “Am I still In America??????”
Reviews.Author: way2go71
Reviews.Content: Upon checking into this facility we were waited on by a girl who seemed to not understand the slightest bit of English. She looked at us like we were the foreigners which made us feel very belittled. Laughing at us didn't help either. She ended up giving us the wrong room keys and overcharged my credit card. She ended up getting someone to help her...someone who was American......THANK GOD!!! The situation was corrected quickly and professionally. The rest of the evening was great. We played in the water park which was also filled with foreigners who didn't speak English very well. That was ok because my kids had a blast! We then had to go back to the front desk to get more towels and 2 girls were standing behind the counter speaking in a foreign language and laughing hysterically. I found this very offensive as did my wife and 2 young children. We felt as though we were being laughed at. All in all this is a wonderful place to stay, clean rooms, awesome water park and a great buffet. A few drawbacks include only wi-fi in the lobby, no microwaves and you have to pay for a refridgerator. If you visit this establishment you might want to request an English speaking individual.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: missouri5
Reviews.Content: Spartan rooms that were not extremely clean. kids feet were black after walking on carpet. waterpark was dirty. i even saw a woman changing a diaper on one of the dining tables. location is midstrip so easy access by car to the landing and silver dollar city.(when there wasn't bumper to bumper traffic)

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: NebraskaJan
Reviews.Content: I took my parents and my grandchildren to Branson for a few days. The front desk ladies were very nice and helpful. We came early and they had the room cleaned right away for us. We ate breakfast at the Grand Country Buffet. It was excellent and the people working there were really personable. We played miniature golf and it was lots of fun. The water park was nicer than one we had stayed in a month earlier. We went to Amazing Pets and it was fun. It was easy to find everything we wanted. The location was really good.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE!! OVERPRICED!!!”
Reviews.Author: simplysweet78
Reviews.Content: I took my 3 kids to the water park ages 4, 6, and 11. My older kids had a nice time but my youngest was not able to enjoy herself much. She was a 1/2 an inch too short to ride on the water slides, the lazy river water was FREEZING, she did not care for the babies area, so she wanted to swim in the pool area.... they closed it 5 mins after she got into it and and hour or so after the opened the park (to do training). It stayed empty with no training for over an hour after they closed it. The only thing my daughter and is did was sit in the kid hot tub area while my other 2 played. On reason my daughter would not even play in the playhouse area is they had the front doors open cooling everything off in there. It was May when we stayed is was not that warm!! I saw many small kids with there parent coming to the hot tub just to warm up their kids (their lips were purple). When I complained to the staff I got nothing! Not even an "I'm sorry" I spent over $50 for my kids to play in the water park and they would have been just at happy playing in the indoor pool at our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mold in room!”
Reviews.Author: MissouriTravelerasdf
Reviews.Content: Grand Country Inn room was extremely moldy. Really moldy! Gave me a headache almost immediately. They were full and couldn't give us another room; the manager sent maintenance up with a air freshener - an ozone generating one that I didn't think would be wise to leave on all the time. Smell returned after couple of hours. I've never had allergies but got bad headache and stuffy nose - woke up couple of hours ago (its about 6am now). We arrived late and tired and it was to late to hunt for a different hotel on this busy Memorial day weekend. Wife and I are trying not to show our disappointment so that kids will enjoy the weekend vacation; but it really hurts us to have to stay in a moldy hotel room. I'd booked two nights but we certainly can't stay in here another night. Hopefully manager will not hold us to paying for another night. If I can edit post later I'll let you know what happens. If you stay at the Grand Country Inn, make sure you arrive early and get a room that is not moldy!

Reviews.Title: “The children loved it”
Reviews.Author: rvander1
Reviews.Content: Hotel worked with us to attain adjoining rooms so we could help with small children. I do wish there was a enclosed walkway to the waterpark, but we bundled the children up so they wouldn't get cold on the short walk. The waterpark is great for young children, but as always people let their children run wild and expect staff to babysit for them. The staff are all curteous and the discounts were a plus. We have stayed here before and will stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We won't be staying here again. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: amyd78
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at Grand Country Inn because our daughter always asks to stay there every time we go to Branson. We only stayed one night and I'm glad that's all we had reserved. We had no complaints about the room itself, it was clean and comfortable, although the bathroom was a little small. We were told when we made our reservation that check-in was at 3 pm. We checked in at 6pm and were told our room wasn't ready yet, we could check back in about an hour. The lady at the desk told us we could go to the waterpark in the meantime, that there were dressing rooms and towels provided. We made our way over to the waterpark and got changed into our swimsuits. The "dressing rooms" were no more than a bathroom with a couple of hotel blow-dryers on the wall, and a bench RIGHT BY THE DOOR where you walk in. They were not very clean. The waterpark was very crowded and noisy and not nearly as exciting as it looks from the outside (most of what you see through the windows driving by is actually ductwork that has been painted, not water slides). After about a half hour, my daughter came to us and said "this isn't very fun, I'm ready to go." We decided to go to the indoor pool and asked the attendant where we get towels. His reply - "I"m out" No offer to get more or telling us when they will be available. We had to go to the front desk (walking outside in 45 degree weather with a wet child) to get towels. The indoor pool was small but okay, and we returned to the waterpark later in the evening. Another complaint about the waterpark is from a safety standpoint. There was not a good spot to sit where I could keep an eye on my child. Nor was there any type of security to ensure that a child is leaving with the adults they arrived with or someone else from their group. With all the noise and chaos someone could easily grab a kid and be gone before it would be noticed. It was in a completely separate building from the hotel with only one person by the door and all he did was hand out towels, when they were available.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms but understaffed”
Reviews.Author: hannah231456
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and the waterpark as well but they told us we would be in our room by 3:00 pm and that did not happen.we checked in at about 3:15 and they told us it wasnt ready so we went back at 3:45 and they were still not ready.She recomended we go to the waterpark{which was very crowded}We came back at About 5:00 pm or 5:30 and our room was just finished.They also have an indoor pool witch was nice.The room was a bit outdated but very clean.i wouldnt recomend it to a kid over 10

Reviews.Title: “Good experience...for the most part!”
Reviews.Author: PARKERSWIFEY
Reviews.Content: We actually just got back from our trip a couple of days ago. First, I will start from our initial booking of the hotel. We decided to book with GCI because it was affordable,in a good location, and because they had the indoor water park. My sister and I were going to be going with her one child and my two. We initially figured we would have to book seperate rooms because of our number of guests. When we called, the lady who helped us book was very informative and helpful. She even suggested we save money by staying in the same room and just requesting a cot for my oldest son. So, that saved us both a lot of money that we could put towards other activities for the kids. We arrived to the hotel around 4pm Friday evening. We went in and paid for our room and were given our keys and wristbands for the indoor waterpark. We were both nervous about the room based on some of the reviews we had read here. We were pleasantly surprised to find our room adequate and CLEAN. The cot was not in our room when we first got there, so we called the front desk and one was sent up immediately. The gentleman that brought it up was more than pleasant.He asked us if we needed assistance setting it up or if we needed anything else! I thought he went above and beyond what most hotel staff members do. After we got settled in our room, we decided to go find some dinner. We chose the Grand Country Buffet, because it was close. It was awesome!!! I have never seen such attentiveness and hospitality at a BUFFET before. We had the sweetest waitress (her name was Rose). She was so kind and helpful! The other staff was very on top of things, some were even checking the temperatures of the food! They were constantly cleaning and making sure everything was perfect. Later that evening, took the kids to the water park. It was just "ok". I'm not going to sugarcoat things..it's nothing special to be quite honest! With it still being cold outside, it seemed like a lot of people were utilitzing it at the same time. The hot tubs were over-ran with small children who probably weren't even old enough to be in it. My kids did like the bucket & the play area...as an adult however, it left much to be desired! The next night, we decided to try the indoor pool. It was worse than the indoor water park! I would urge anyone to be aware....if this is your main reason for staying here-you just might be dissapointed. The rooms and staff @ the hotel are awesome! We even checked out a day early and were given a full refund-no questions asked! I just am not sure about the pool situation...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Grand Country Inn”
Reviews.Author: legalbreeze
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group of 9 children ages 2-12, along with parents and grandparents. This property went above and beyond, honoring our request for adjoining rooms and putting the rooms in a block. Rooms were clean, plenty of space.
