I do wish there was a frig/microwave in the room but the buffets for breakfast and dinner were affordable and great. The indoor waterpark was likewise clean and with something for everyone. They also have a great VIP program you can sign up for with good discounts on eating and subsequent stays. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: nikkiu92
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Grand Country Inn for a week and were very pleased! About a week before we were set to leave for our trip, I stumbled across this website. After reading some of the reviews posted, we seriously considered cancelling our reservation and staying somewhere else! But boy am I ever glad that we didn't! I don't know what some of the others are complaining about, but we had no problems. Check in took less than 5 min. and our room was clean and smelled fresh when we arrived. We took advantage of both the waterpark park and swimming pool almost every night, after a long day of sight seeing, it was great just to unwind and let the kids burn off some energy. Our kids (ages: 3, 5 & 7) had a ball! Although we didn't have time to check out the buffett or mini golf, what we did do was great. The hotel is practically in the middle of the strip and Wal-Mart is just across the street if you need anything. I think with all that this hotel has to offer, you could almost just stay here as a short vacation! Also the price was only about $10 higher than the cheapest hotel we found and cheaper than some, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were fine but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: littlepinkpig
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at Grand Country with my parents and my nine year old. We were prepared for a basic room from the reviews--our main attraction to the motel was the indoor water park for our child. We almost cancelled our reservation upon checking in as the front desk staff were quite rude and dismissive. We asked to talk with the manager and she was the rudest one of all. We also witnessed a male staff member at the desk yelling at an older gentleman who was trying to check-in. It was an immediate turn-off but our boy was so excited about the waterpark that we decided to stay. The room was clean and basic. They did have plenty of towels, toiletries, and a small coffeepot. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were good. Bring some pillows if you don't like flat ones. The waterpark was clean and our child LOVED it. The water, however, was cold. The hot tub was very nice and the lazy river was a tolerable temp. Kids didn't mind the cold at all as they were having a blast. We don't do buffets so we didn't see the restaurants at all. There is a Shoney's, McDonald's, Walmart, grocery store and Taco Bell right across the street. There is a gas station and a convenience store right next door. This is an extremely nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, bad staff”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old son and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. We were drawn to the hotel for the water park. We had fun at the water park, but we won't stay at the hotel again. The resort had some good things going for it, but some things were bad for us. 1. The walls are thin and you can hear everything outside. We were right by stairs and could hear people going up and down. 2. Worst thing was on our last morning, we were trying to sleep in as we don't get to at home. At 8 am someone tried to come in our room. If I had not had our safety lock on our door locked they would have came in the room. I looked outside and it was one of the housekeepers. I mentioned this to the clerk on checking out and nothing was done. All they said was sorry! 3. Water park was ok but small and crowded. They did not have a big enough pool for kids just to swim in. Therefore all the kids were swimming in the hot tubs. Can't say that was relaxing. However, the hot tubs were not hot anyways! My son loved the water fort place and running around there. I was glad the price was part of the hotel as I don't think I would want to pay extra to go there. We were able to get a room in the building right by the waterpark. I should say for $10 more we were able to. I am glad to have that though as it was very cold out and the other buildings were far from the waterpark. My son did like the indoor golf. It was to expensive though. It was $12 for my son and I for 18 holes. They are not hard to do and so it only took about 30 minutes to get through the course. Good for young kids like my son as it was pretty easy to get it in the hole. Also, this hotel is very good for back road access. I was able to go back roads and avoid 76 and the traffic. That was a big plus. The rooms very clean and the beds were very comfortable. All in all, not a super bad place, but I do not like the fact of the hotel room doors facing outside, housekeeping staff, lack of caring of hotel management when problems happening, and value of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmccowan
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in May of this year. Upon arrival we were greeted very nicely. The clerk gave us a discount for staying 4 nights. Our room was on the side facing the water park. It was a short walk the the water park. You do have to walk or drive to the water park because it is sperated from the hotel. Parking on the west side is tight. Our room was nice & clean. We walked around & checked out the resturant & gift shop. We had breakfast on morning at the buffet. The food was good but for the price I would rather eat some place else that was a little cheaper. Also Walmart is just down the street. All in all it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointed......”
Reviews.Author: v10mercury
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grand Country Inn for the indoor waterpark and were very excited to stay there. At check-in the desk clerks were not very friendly at all. Our room was several buildings away from the waterpark and we were dissappointed that we had to drive there instead of walking. We were even more upset when we could not find a parking space upon our return to our building. Our room was clean but very basic....and not what I expected after the price of the room. We could hear everything that was going on outside the room. We could hear the tv in the room next to us, people talking as they walked by the room, and it sounded like people were running up and down the stairs until after midnight. Around midnight I was ready to go to another hotel...but things finally quited down. The waterpark was also smaller then expected. We have a 4 year old and there was not much he could do. The lifeguards were also inattentive and rude. We spent maybe an hour there. We only stayed one night and the next morning a woman with the hotel was walking around outside the rooms asking people if they were ready to check-out or leave....it was only 9 am and we had until 11am. We were very disappointed and will not be staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Grand at all!!”
Reviews.Author: asundaygirl
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. Before we left home I called to confirm the 3pm check-in and left in time to make that. When we arrived at about 2:55 they told us (and not very politely) to check back in 1 hour to see if our room was ready. That forced us to either sit in our car in the Aug heat or go find a place to sit in until the room was ready. I was not happy about that. Our room was very far away from the indoor pool. I would not let young children walk over there. The pool and pool area are much overrated, it is so hot, humid, muggy in there and makes it almost unbearable for those sitting on the sidelines. I don't think they have any air circulation at all. The room was a very basic room, adequate at best. There were children running up and down the walkways and making noise way into the night, which was quite disruptive. I expected more for the price I paid. I will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Kids love it”
Reviews.Author: dewthedew
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at GCI many times. The water park is the big draw. If it rains the kids have something to do. At the end of the day the kids have something to do. The morning before you leave and are packing the kids have something to do. When your money runs out the kids have something to do. Our youngest son is 10 and our oldest is 19. By about 16-17 our oldest son was sort of loosing major interest in the water park...except for the basketball area where he plays and hopes for a little meet the girl action. Our younger boy still has a great time. The older boy wouldn't be thrilled at a regular pool either as offered at other hotels in the area. So it's worth the stay even if it's to keep the younger child occupied. Now for my husband and I...the fact the kids are entertained is a big load off of us as it gets tiring to try and keep them busy every minute. The major down side is that there is not a comfortable chair in the hotel room. After a day at Silver Dollar City, walking 76 HWY, go carting and putt putting we'd just like to sit in a comfortable chair. Proping up pillows on the bed is only so good. We suggest asking for extra pillows and towels when you arrive. We would recommend this hotel for one or two nights. If you are going to stay longer the lack of adult friendly accomodations really shows it wear and paying for a hotel suite will be well worth the money for the other nights of your stay. Will we go back. Sure, but we'll never stay more than 2 nights. If they'd put in a recliner we'd stay a week.

Reviews.Title: “The kids loved it...”
Reviews.Author: EspressoMamma
Reviews.Content: The hotel property has everything their website boasts and our kids -- two boys ages 8 and 6, loved it. We stayed in a single room with two queens -- very basic, no frills. Upon check-in, we noticed that our dead-bolt didn't work properly and a maintenance technician repaired it within 20 minutes. Our room was about a hundred yards from the indoor/outdoor water park, so walking there was not an issue. In hind sight, we should have brought a change of clothes because walking back in our wet swimsuits was a drag! The outdoor water park is for little kids, toddler age. The indoor park is perfect for ages 5 and up. My husband and I loved the lazy river. I wouldn't have paid to go to this waterpark, but since it was included with the price of our room, we took advantage of it. The property also has two outdoor pools and one indoor pool, but we never had time to use them. The indoor mini-golf was perfect for us one night after we sweltered in the 100 degree heat at Silver Dollar City all day. There are two 18-hole courses, open until midnight. It cost us $36 for the 4 of us, with the hotel guest discount, for all 36 holes and was worth it. We never ate at their famous country buffet, but we did eat at their all-you-can-eat pizza & salad buffet one night. I really enjoyed their spinach-mushroom pizza, my husband enjoyed their BBQ pizza and the kids loved everything, especially their dessert breads! Overall, this is a neat place and perfect for families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “Much improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: C_and_H_in_Staunton
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here in June 2008. My wife thought it would be great with the indoor water park. If it rained on any day of our trip we could always stay at the hotel with the kids. I will admit, the indoor water park is pretty impressive for something that is inside. However, for us, there were more cons than pros. This facility did seem clean, everywhere that we went. The staff at the lobby was very cordial. There are several swimming pools, both indoor and out. Our room was clean and the beds were Ok. There is barely enough room for a rollaway, but it will fit if you move the table and chairs over close to the bathroom area. This place is like a complex and some of the buildings are a considerable distance from the restaraunts and indoor water park. If you drive to the forward parking lot you risk losing your parking place at your room and parking seems to be always full. We had a tendency to walk, but for some this may pose a problem. The housekeeping staff was friendly but are almost all foreign and most speak very little English. (there were union picketers out front for this reason) I had to talk to three different people in order to get enough towels for our room (family of 6, room stocked with towels for two). They were out of towels! The indoor water park provides towels, but those must be left there. For the pools, you use your room towels, if you can get any. On site is the Grand Country Buffet. It is somewhat pricey while the food is just Ok. If you stay here, Shoney's is right across the street (you can walk to it) and has the same quality food that is considerably cheaper. Basically, this is a tourist trap within a tourist trap. You are right in the middle of 76, so traffic during the day is impossible. Walmart is within walking distance as well, and that was a plus. For some, this may be the perfect place, but it was not for us.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Country Inn -- Not for us”
Reviews.Author: OzarkGirl75
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Country Inn and can honestly say that we will not stay there again. When I booked the room, I told the lady that I needed to be as far away from smoking as possible due to my sons lung issues, she said that I would have to pay $10 more per night to stay in building "A" (which happens to be closest to the water park area) which is all non smoking. When we got to the room, which had a couple of dead bugs on the walls and was not very clean, they did not even change our sheets the 3 nights we were there, we found that we were right next to an area where the employees stand outside and smoke. So basically we paid more for nothing. Also, if you are going to stay at this hotel please be aware that the indoor water park closes at 10 pm, is not that clean and my boys ages 3, 7, and 8 did not enjoy the indoor water park, they wanted to go to the regular pool outside. So save your money or just get a regular hotel and pay to go to White Water, it is definitely much more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids.”
Reviews.Author: tdctds
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you have children. The staff were all very nice and courteous/helpful. The rooms were clean and decor was nice. Air conditioning worked great. Carpet was pretty dirty, as indicated by my daughter's feet so might want to wear socks or shoes in the room. Bed was comfortable. The kids loved the waterpark, especially the outside waterpark. The indoor waterpark is okay if you have kids a older than 5. The lazy river was kind of a disappointment, as it was crowded and too many bratty kids racing through it and knocking into you. My daughter and niece loved the outdoor waterpark and it was nice to be able to sit where we had a good view of our kids. We didn't see any shows or eat at any of the restaurants but everything was convenient to get to. We stayed in building # 3 which is farthest from waterpark but nicest place to stay, I think, because there aren't as many people going in and out around the building. Check out was very quick, just had to turn in our keys. They still use regular keys, so you do have a bulky key and keychain to carry around rather than a plastic key card. We also used the pool next to the building we stayed in and it was nice. Good size, not too crowded. Overall, I was very pleased with our stay. I would recommend this place if you have children. If I go to Branson without kids though, I won't stay here. It's more family oriented. The price, I thought, was reasonable. Oh, and they give you a discount card for several amenities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Coachwf
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Grand Country Inn. I got their platinum package listed on their website and added an extra night. Note that the kid price of an additional $59 also included all tickets or vouchers we received as adults. My party consisted of myself, my wife, two girls (7 & 3) and our 5 month old son. My primary concern going in was how clean the room would be. I was very pleased. Room is an average hotel room, as I expected for the price, but it was very clean. Had 2 queen beds, small bathroom with the sink outside the bathroom. Plenty of room for our family. No refrigerator or microwave, but for $11 you can get a small refrigerator for the length of your stay. Service was very friendly. Indoor and outdoor water parks were great for the kids. Water was clean. Also had 2 outdoor pools and one indoor pool that was open until midnight. Lifeguards on duty all over the water parks. Most were teens from outside the US. Girl at the front desk was Russian so language is a slight barrier, but they were friendly when spoken to. Note that you do have to walk outside to get to all of the pools and water parks, but it only takes a couple minutes. Worked out great for us. Locations is great! Right in the heart of 76. Buffet is the best in town (I've eaten all over the 4 times I've traveled to Branson) and we got a free show with our stay. We saw the Amazing Pets Show and the kids loved it. Will definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Country not so Grand”
Reviews.Author: Ron_McLaughlin
Reviews.Content: I'm still here, but I just had a big cockroach crawl out on the nightstand beside the bed in broad daylight. It is now a dead cockroach. I took it to the lobby. They didn't offer much apology. You might want to bring your own towels, the ones in the room are very rough. Oh, bring your own TP too, it's rough too. On the positive side, the AC works fine. Finally, you have to go to the lobby to connect to the internet. That's where I am writing this from. Only stay if you really want to go to the water park part.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate with this one.”
Reviews.Author: GrammieArkansas
Reviews.Content: A coworker told me about this place so I ventured on my own for a two hour drive with my 3 (ages 9,7,4) grandchildren for an overnight. I was thrilled with our stay and the children didnt want to leave. The staff is friendly and helpful. I was a little concerned that our room was in a building other than the main building, but it is a nice walk or short drive to the main parking lot. The park water is clear and odorless, and the rooms are so clean!!! I am fussy about the bed and it was very comfy. Yes, there are lifeguards who are great at keeping all safe.I was so happy to see them. I couldn't keep my eyes on all 3 at once! The grill inside the water park was a great find with the usually finger food fare. The buffet surprised me with all of the variety. The Amazing Pet Show is a must see and very fun. You can be here for days and never have to leave the property. We are already planning our next visit !!

Reviews.Title: “It was worth the price of room for included waterpark access”
Reviews.Author: pumpooga
Reviews.Content: We booked a couple days before going down to Branson. My 20mos daughter LOVED the toddler area although the entire indoor and outdoor parts needed renovating. The outdoor park was completely shut down both days we were there and the outdoor pool was shut down on Monday as well. (We stayed Sunday night) Our room was within reasonable distance from the waterpark although we did pay the $10 to be closer to it- wasn't worth the extra $$ since the walk from the second set of rooms isn't horrible. There were only 2 lifeguards that actually did their job making sure unsupervised kids weren't toppling over unsuspecting guests on the lazy river as well as unsupervised toddlers that had the run of the toddler area. We still enjoyed our night away, though. It was worth the complications to see our daughter enjoy her time. Although on Monday the toddler area indoors was completely shut down. ALL day long- WHAT a bummer being that I had a toddler... repainting and maintenance. Would have gone a different weekend if we were told the outdoor AND indoor toddler areas would be unavailable at any time. We did find seclusion in the indoor pool located down by the second set of rooms and enjoyed the pool all to ourselves- that, was very nice. The buffet (brunch) was expensive and we'd of rathered Shoney's just across the street. Walking distance from the shoppe, music hall, gift shoppes, and buffet was nice. We met one very nice lady on staff to fill a bear for our daughter but the remaining staff inside the Fudge Gift Shoppe place were completely miserable and lacked common courtesy for paying customers- it's amazing how others have run into this problem as well. We were given a brochure that wasn't suppose to go out after Memorial Day so on Sunday night, when we tried to order a pizza, at quarter to 8PM the shoppe had already closed and blamed the miscommunication on the hand-out error. Yeah, wasn't our fault we're actually just the customers...

Reviews.Title: “nice waterpark”
Reviews.Author: vacationlover73
Reviews.Content: The nice thing about the grand country inn is the food, arcades, indoor putt-putt golf and of course the indoor waterpark that surrounds the hotel. The rooms are o.k. but they are not worth the money. If you were not planning on using the waterpark then there is no way i would recommend staying here. If there is a family of four and you are planning on going to the indoor waterpark then you are going to pay $60.00 for that if you stay somewhere else so you might as well stay at the Grand Country.

Reviews.Title: “Branson in Winter (Grand Country Inn)”
Reviews.Author: brett_levi
Reviews.Content: Branson slows down a lot after the Christmas season. There are still several good shows. Crowds are at an extreme minimum. Sales are at an extreme maximum. You can catch a lot of post holiday and winter clearance sales. The Grand Country Inn is the best place to stay with kids. They have an enormous indoor water park with waterslides, pools, hot tubs, lazy river and more. Grand Country needs a refresher in customer service, but the beds are great. Not as much activity as summer, but still a great way to get out of the house during cold months especially with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “OK but could do better”
Reviews.Author: rugrats_reptar
Reviews.Content: The good things are that the hotel is located right on the strip where all the action is. Their buffet was good and we had coupons to save money on them. They have an indoor & outdoor waterpark. They also had indoor minature golf which was a blessing since it rained every day we were there. The bad things were: the indoor & outdoor waterpark were much smaller than what appeared in the pictures. The waterparks were quite a distance from our hotel room. The room was fairly small with an even smaller bathroom which was barely big enough to turn around in. The rooms had a strange odor to them. If you are looking for luxury then this isn't the place. I have stayed in a Great wolf lodge hotel and it was 20 times better than this hotel. I would recommend staying in another hotel and going to the White water park instead. Or just saving your money and geting a nice hotel with a nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Fun for Everyone!”
Reviews.Author: OkieMomof3_8
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! The hotel was not fancy, but clean and adequate. Since the price of the hotel room included the water park, we did not feel the room was overpriced at all. We played for hours in the water park and ate supper at the grill located inside the water park. The food was reasonably priced and the portions were big. Yum! All the employees were nice and helpful, especially the ladies who worked at the buffet. We ate breakfast there and it was sooo good!!! We only stayed one night and figured the one evening of water fun was all that was included, but to our surprise, the front desk clerk told us the kids could splash all that day too!-even though we had checked out! How cool was that?!!! Dad needed something to do with our younger kids while the older one and I shopped, so this was perfect and such a nice surprise. We saw the Amazing Pets Show while we were there too and it was very cute especially for younger kids- (under 12) A lot of people have said negative things on this site about this hotel. I can't imagine why! We had a great time and will definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and "no deal" at all!!!!”
Reviews.Author: overrated
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter was in a competition so we booked a room for two nights. We also booked a room for one night for my daughter and her husband so we could be near the competition which was being held in the music hall. We were in a room which was down a hill and in building 2. My daughter was in a room in building one. I had made reservations on the phone. The staff got the accomendations mixed up and we were charged for an extra night. We did get a partial credit for the room mix-up, but not a full refund. The next morning we had to move from building 2 up to building one . So we had to move twice. No one was interested in good customer service which I have never experienced in any oither motel in Branson. The only thing free was coffee and tea. Most places will give you free dinner tickets and some give free show tickets. This place is over priced and over rated. The indoor waterpark was ok and good for kids but that is the only thing good I can say about this place. If you want to stay in Branson I suggest you think twice about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: ratemyvacation
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. OVERPRICED ROOMS!! $119 + tax for a regular room with no microwave or fridge & a TINY bathroom!! ($10 extra if you want to be close to the waterpark) I had booked my reservations via the phone months ahead of time & was given a rate which included tax. I called the day before I arrived to comfirm my reservation. Upon arrival I was charged alot more that I had comfirmed my reservation for. They said "I don't know where you got that rate from" & refused to lower my rate. I was very unhappy. BE SURE IF YOU MAKE RESERVATIONS TO GET YOUR RATE IN WRITTING!!! If it wasn't a Holiday we'd have stayed somewhere else, cause it gets worse. (all other hotels were booked up) The property was Dirty & we had found a roach in our room upon check in. We complained to the front desk & they did nothing. The next morning they sent housekeeping to our room who called an exterminator & they sprayed our room. Our air unit in our room made a loud noise. We went to the indoor/outdoor waterpark which was a lot smaller that expected. After a few hours we had to leave because the chemical smells from the indoor pools made our heads hurt & made the kids sick. My husband had left a complaint in the office about our room & check in & was told a manager would contact us, which has yet to happen. I will NEVER stay here again & I do NOT recommend it to anyone. There is no manager on duty so if anything goes wrong there policy is "oh well" My advice, if you just have to go to the water park, stay somewhere else & buy tickets to go. I think you can get 5 for $90. We spent $270 for a 2 nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed..........”
Reviews.Author: jamieallen
Reviews.Content: Well, when we arrived at the grand country inn, we realized that their isn't really anything grand about it. It's a normal hotel like the one we paid $55 for a night last year there. They put us in a room on the other side of the parking lot where we would have to drive to the waterpark and pool. We called and wanted something closer and they said they didn't have anything closer and all the rooms were booked. We were also ont he top floor and wanted the bottom and they said their was nothing availiable. Well, I decided to call back again and I spoke with another girl who got the manager and she said their was a room open directly across from the indoor waterpark so she let us stay there. it's funny how 5 minuted before their wasn't a single room open. So I guess it pays to be persistent. Well, the room was normal and the indoor waterpark was very small and the lazy river was very overcrowded. I guess it's kinda a good deal for the waterpark and room for a $100 a night so we still had fun but if you book a room make sure it's close to the waterpark or be prepared to drive to it or a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for family fun”
Reviews.Author: MountainMurf
Reviews.Content: My wife took the grandkids to Branson and stayed at the Grand Country Inn because of the waterpark that was included in the rates. They all loved it. When registering, she asked if they accepted an AARP discount and the manager said no but let's see what other discounts there are. The manager asked if this was their first visit and she replied yes. Ok, that's a 10% discount! The rest of the staff were very helpful and they made sure there were always more than enough towels. The buffet was very good and the hotel was also close to fast food joints, the Ducks and the go-karts Also, it was close to a road that will detour you around the main strip to avoid the horrible traffic. This should be a first choice place to stay if you are bringing kids.

Reviews.Title: “WILL GO AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: miranda14
Reviews.Content: We went up on Saturday and my daughter had to go to the water park when we got there 730 pm there was few people in there. Then we went to the indoor pool they have that is just for guest that was great... NOONE in there had the place to our selves. Our room was very clean and great service.. The price is high for Branson but I love where it is and easy to get in and out of. I do agree with the others the gift shop staff needs to learn customer service. But I enjoyed our 4 day stay and will be back before the end of summer.

Reviews.Title: “mostly good”
Reviews.Author: poppy509
Reviews.Content: Booked over the phone, great water park for the kids, if they are 42" tall. Enjoyed our stay clean and the hotel staff was friendly but the gift shop staff was stuck up. Good place to stay if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “I would do it all over again!”
Reviews.Author: angel14
Reviews.Content: My family and I went there last week and had a blast! I sure do feel bad for the people who weren't able to have a good time. I read the reviews and was a little nervous about staying at this hotel,but I'm glad we went ! The small rooms only made the family bonding excellent! All I can say to the people who wrote bad reviews is that sometimes you need to loosen up and chill out! My ten year old and one year old loved the water park and I vote for doing it again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Water Park great ! employees not!!!”
Reviews.Author: familyfuntexas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times the rooms or basic, but mostly clean, the maids or always very loud in the mornings the are friendly, but loud outside your room, The Pizza is not good but the buffet is good for breakfast, the game room is fun but when you spend 30 dollars and win tickets the prizes or very cheap, the empolyees at the game room have always been nice, the minature golf is beautiful, but a little to much money for a child to play, the indoor pool is always warm. My only and worst complaint is the waterpark, they really have something great going on there, it is warm in side and lots of fun, but the manager is really really bad I think his name is tico or tido any way he is not child or peoply friendly at all !!!! Each time I have been they close the park 20 to 30 minuates early, we all have jobs and want to go home early, so I can almost understand this, but you pay average 100 plus to stay at the hotel for the waterpark and it shoul be open until the time the fromt desk told you it would be open, while they are rushing you out like it is a fire or something they all just stand around and talk afrer you leave that is an extra 20 minuates or so you children could be playing, I think the hotel would do better to get adults and pay them a little extra and have HAPPY CUSTOMERS !!! Any employee can be replaced and I hope some day soon he is. when you complain to the front desk they say, he is the manager but I am sure he has a BOSS somewhere !!! Please talk to him!!!

Reviews.Title: “No privacy in rooms”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travelUsa
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will agree with another poster that this place is highly overrated. I would much rather have stayed at a better hotel and just paid for a daily trip to the water park. The rooms are very small and the carpet is dirty. The bathroom is the smallest I have ever seen! If you have teenagers, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! There is absolutely no privacy!!! The bathrooms are so small that you can't even turn around in them! There are no extras such as a coffee maker, refrigerator, etc. For the price they charge there should be! Another thing, the hair dryer that they advertise having, DOES NOT WORK!!! Bring your own if you plan on staying there. I'm not sure if it is the time of year that I went, but it seems like Branson as a whole is well, for lack of better words, RAN DOWN. There are a million Welcoming Centers which is complete overkill. Most of them are full of useless information. Oh yeah, plan on spending at least $25 a meal at most places along the main strip on 76 unless you are lucky enough to stay in a hotel with a kitchen or kitchenette. After our stay here, I think I will opt for Florida the next time. Believe it or not, I think it would be cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!!”
Reviews.Author: St.Louisconsumer
Reviews.Content: Reservations for 2 families, 3 rooms, were made over the phone two weeks prior to visit. Phone reservationist GUARANTEED rooms would be in building #1, closest to the waterpark, and we agreed to an upcharge to have the convenience. Upon arrival we were told that nothing was available in building #1, that reservations only hold a room, not a particular building, and that they do NOT guarantee certain rooms. Inexperienced staff did not know what to do. After 1 hour to check in, we found our rooms, HIKED up a steep hill and across a parking lot to see the waterpark, only to find it PACKED. Every pool and hot tub were so full, it looked like no one else would fit. We went back to the front desk to check-out and cancel our stay, at which point we were told that there WERE rooms available in Building #1! We were quite upset at this point, having been LIED to regarding our reservation and room availability. They were scrambling to find rooms for us that only 1 hour prior were not available, nor would they be available at all during the weekend... what a Miracle! We took our refund and stayed at the MUSIC CAPITAL INN instead... great (cheaper) rates, much cleaner, big pool, excercise room, free breakfast... all indoors! The kids had fun, could actually swim, and we didn't have to HIKE to get there! Save yourself the aggrevation- DON'T STAY AT GRAND COUNTRY INN!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: dansee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were adequate. Buffet was good but grew tiresome. The property is laid out poorly for pedestrian traffic. There were no sidewalks to the main area from the west rooms. The pool area was decent for a day but no more. We paid extra for a room by the pool, litte did we know we still had to walk outside (it was cold for the kids) a considerable distance. I'm glad we paid the extra, because the east rooms would have been a very long walk outside to the indoor pool area. We stayed because we love the shows. Probably would not stay again. To many choices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: miss-dotty
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel, the people, and the shows, the food, we just really enjoyed ourselves. We are planning on going back in Nov.2006. This time for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Too much dough”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Tulsa
Reviews.Content: Overall good experience, but next time we'll stay somewhere less expensive. It cost us 225 for 2 nights which was too much. It was like an old motor inn, basic room with a bed. I will say the breakfast buffet was probably the best I've had. The service was good, the room was clean. The water park was ok, but not great. A hotel with a pool for less money would have been a better choice. It was just priced too high.

Reviews.Title: “More hotel for your money”
Reviews.Author: cocodoll
Reviews.Content: I've read so many of the stories from unhappy guests, and frankly I'm shocked. I'm used to staying in upscale, high end hotels, and even though this is an average accomodation, it is more hotel for your money. With your room stay, waterpark admission is free - that is a huge bonus when you're traveling in the winter with children or teenagers. Even my parents thought the waterpark was great! I've been two years in a row, and am scheduling our thrid trip as we speak. I have never had an encounter with any personnel that were "rude", nor have I had disgustingly "dirty" carpet, or light bulbs that were burnt out and the staff refused to replace. I've never had anything but a great experience. We stay two nights in November, and we will continue to make this a tradition in our family, even when we have grandkids. If you're expecting upscale, high end, it is not, but it is a perfect hotel for the price you pay - if you take advantage of the indoor waterpark.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty carpet”
Reviews.Author: barbeq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand country Inn for 3 nights. The staff at the desk were OK. My BIGGEST complaint about this hotel is that the carpet is always DIRTY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I have to tell the kids to always wear shoes in the room because their socks will get horribly dirty and have to be changed within 5 minutes. I called the desk when we arrived to our room, due to the carpet being dirty again(we stayed 3 years ago here with the same problem)and they said they could move us to building 3(which is farther from the waterpark). After seeing the extra distance from the water park, I decided to just stay put in Bldg 2. I wish they would clean the carpet instead of coming up with excuses as to why it is dirty. They told me due to the fact our room was on the street level, it caused the carpet to get dirtier. Funny thing, 3 years ago we stayed on the second level and the carpet was FILTHY. So, that is not the reason. The reason it is SO dirty is because people are tracking wet feet and bodies in /out from using the waterpark. Also, I think they should give repeat customers a discount when staying at this hotel. I think that would be a friendly gesture, don't you? DEAR HOTEL, PLEASE CLEAN THE CARPET!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If cleaning is out of the question, an immediate discount should be applied. BUT, the answer I got from that request was that the manager wouldn't be in until tomorrow and they couldn't guarantee anything. If not for the waterpark, I wouldn't stay there! Very mediocre room.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: LilDowns
Reviews.Content: We arrived late Friday evening and were greeted by the rudest front desk help I have ever encountered. Our room was decent, although nothing special. The ice machine was either broken or had been used so much that it hadn't caught up from the day. Saturday morning we ate at the buffett. Some of the staff was friendly at best and the food was mediocre. The Indoor Waterpark, that is so greatly advertised, was nothing like my children or I had envisioned. The staff was rude & although we had fun, it wasn't any better than most waterparks in smalltowns all across the U.S.A.! Unless you are into highly overrated, overpriced vacations I would recommend trying one of the smaller places in Branson where the rooms are clean and the service is friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Country Inn for only one night but it's convinced us to go back for a birthday party! The kids had a blast at the waterpark, there was always something for them to do. The slides were the hot ride for the day but the rest of it was certainly enjoyed too. Our rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The pizza buffet was a short walk across a parking lot and was certainly decent for the price. Plus we didn't have to go far for some shopping. We paid extra to get into the first building and we're glad that we did. All in all we had a great time. If you have young children it is completely worth the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: AliasAnn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two day stay at the Grand Country. I would NEVER stay at this place again. The rooms are average, yet ours didn't even have an ice bucket. We had a lightbulb burned out and called the front desk on Tuesday, they still hadn't replaced it when we checked out Thursday! We stayed in building two, and all night long, both nights, teenagers were hanging around outside making noise, we didn't get much sleep. On top of that, our room was located right next to the stairs so we heard everyone staying on the 2nd floor going up and down the stairs all night. Now as for the water park lifeguards and water park management. They are without a doubt the rudest individuals I have ever come across. Everytime you turn around they are blowing their whistles at the kids. My daughter got the whistle blown at her while trying to get into the innertube in the Lazy River, the lifeguard Nathan, said she was holding up others. The only others in the river at the time were my other daughter, my son and myself. This 16 year old kid, thinks he is "IMPORTANT" because he RULES over the lazy river. His manager is no better. Maybe 20 years old and the RUDEST person I have ever met in my life! When I complained to him he said " so what, she was breaking the rules", when I told him that the Great Wolf Lodge had twice the amount of activities and the lifeguards were more professional, his response was " well, they are also about $200 a night more expensive then we are". he then said ? we'll see ya later". He then turned around and started talking to his " friends" about what they were going to do that weekend. I will be writing a strongly worded letter to the Hotel Management over this sorry excuse of a manager and his staff. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again. It was TERRIBLE. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT book a room here, stay at one of the other smaller hotels that treat their guests LIKE GUESTS. There is enough to do in Branson that paying the extra money for a room here isn't worth it, you can always find something to do in Branson without paying to have your kids yelled at. Spend a bit less for a hotel room and then you have more to spend for other attractions that are worth it, cuz the Grand County Hell Inn ISN"T Worth the hassle!!!! Contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain - If you do you are in the wrong place . . .”
Reviews.Author: cowboyshooter
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the 4 day, 3 night platinum package stay at the Grand Country Inn. Okay, per previous posts this is NOT a luxury hotel. Motel 6, average Best Westerns, EconoLodge would be equal stays. You pay for "kid" amenities that they like and that you don't necessarily like. Water Park is fine. 11 year old girl liked it and had fun. Any older and yes they will prefer White Water. Mine would have but chose the 3 days of this water vs 1 day only at White Water. Rooms are standard sized for a 3 level outdoor entrance motel. Cable, small TVs, iron, plently of towels. Food buffet was good. Liked cold foods being cold and hot foods hot. Liked seeing staff checking temps with temp guns. Seperate Pizza and ice cream shop with reasonable prices. 36 hole indoor mini golf. 4 in-house shows to choose from. Grand Jubilee was excellent - as good as anything that won American Idol. Parking and access good. 3rd building is away from water park, but it is a 200 yard walk with sidewalks. I liked the package deal, 2 day Silver Dollar City passes, 2 breakfast buffets, 1 show, 1 minigolf and waterpark for 4 persons. It was a fine deal. Yes a lot of kids but if you didn't have kids you would not stay. If you have young kids, are used to going to soccor games, and the like, you will be at home here. If you want to be pampered, choose elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: kayell2
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time staying at Grand Country. We were on Spring Break, knew it would be cold, and wanted to use the indoor water park. It was fun, but I hate that during times when there is no vacancy at the hotel, they allow anyone to walk off the street and buy admission to the water park for $15. If they're sold out, don't they think the water park will already be crowded enough? The rooms had been updated since our last stay... new TVs, ironing board and iron, hair dryer. We paid extra for a room in the building next to the water park and were glad we did as it was so cold during our trip. Love the buffet restaurant and my kids love the game room. However, on our second day, I came to the realization that this hotel is just not for us. We are a family of 5 and the rooms are just too small for us to fit comfortably. They are so busy (and have been during every stay) that the rooms are not cleaned until late in the day, and that's a huge pet peeve of mine. We ended up checking out the next morning and moving to a less expensive hotel where we could get 2 rooms. No big problems with Grand Country, just the room being too small and my dislike of crowds that finally convinced me that it's not the place for us. The water park was super fun when the kids were smaller but now White Water holds more thrills.

Reviews.Title: “With Kids - Stay here”
Reviews.Author: allamerican6
Reviews.Content: I was here during Memorial Day weekend 2006. Paid $99. No real military discount. The grounds are clean. The pools are very clean and WARM (inside) (I am a pool connoisseur - a hard critic). I rate these pools to the Wolf Lodge I’ve been to. The outside pool is great for little kids. We went to the Animal Comedy Show. It was good. I don't need to see it again but good. The buffet was very impressive. The food was great. Not what you find at a typical Ryans. They have an indoor put put course dimly lit that is very well maintained and decorated. Problems: the room was less than a Motel 6. A 13" TV. No stand to put your suitcase on. Very austere. Clean but austere. But I wasn't there for the room. I was there for my kid to play in the pool. I would go again and I have a reservation for the big car show on 13 August.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Water Park and Buffet”
Reviews.Author: pmo397
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the indoor water park. We took our 3 and 5 yr old grand-daughters there. It was great for their age group. I could see how teens would be board, but the little ones loved it. They spend 4 hours running back and forth between the 2 kiddie areas. Everything was neat and clean. The life guards were very friendly and patient with the little ones. When I made the reservation there were no rooms left in building 1. I was expecting to be in one of the back building and have to drive up to take the girls to the water park. That would have been o.k. too. I know it is impossible to build all the building around the park. To our supprise, when we checked in they now had a vacancy in building #1, so we didd't have to walk or drive anywhere. The staff was very nice and polite. The rooms were adequate. They had 2 queen beds, blow dryer, iron and ironing board. The only thing missing was a coffee maker.The walls are a little thin, fortunatly everyone seemed to be asleep by 10pm that night. We ate at the buffet and the food was excellent. We tried the cat fish, ribs, chicken, the girls loved the creamy mac and cheese. The breads and deserts (brownee,coblers and soft serve chocolate and vanilla ice cream were yummy. I can forsee the water parks to be very crowded in the summer time. We will go back again in the fall for my grand-daughters bithday.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't of found a better place to take my grandkids!”
Reviews.Author: Missouri49
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I found out about this place. I wanted to take my grandkids, (8 of them rangeing from 3yrs.to 16yrs.), on a mini vacation that wouldn't cost me a small fortune. You can imagine how hard it was to be able to find someplace that would appeal to the various ages. Then I discovered this place. I read the reviews and decided to take the chance and book 2 rooms w/ a refrig.. My daughter-in-law went with me, no way could I have handled all the kids by myself. We had planned if by chance we didn't like the place once we got there we would go somewherelse but as it turned out it was great! The rooms were clean and the staff was the nicest I have ever met. I've been to Branson many times and have stayed in many of the motels there and none of the staff have been nicer than this place. If we needed anything all we had to do was call front desk and they brought it to us very quickly. Now I only had two suggestions: to furnish more towels when they know there's alot of people in the room, to offer a discount when staying more than a couple of days. The food at their resturant was wonderful. The kids just loved the indoor water park and the outdoor water park and pools. Our visit to this motel furnished everything I was wanting for this trip and saved me alot of money. It would have cost me a whole lot more if we had stayed somewherelse and then visited a waterpark everyday we were there. In my opinion, this is a perfect place to stay w/ children. Now don't get me wrong, if I was going to Branson w/out children I wouldn't stay here but w/kids it's perfect. We are planning a return visit this year. I asked my grandchildren, well where would you like to go this year for a vacation? They all said, Branson!!! So we will be going back this year. I just smiled and thought to myself....Oh Thank God! I don't have to surf the internet for hours again!!! And the best part....I'll save money!!! :) Grateful Nanie!

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: hwnraine
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a four day visit to Branson, MO and my family and I stayed at the Grand Country Inn. The hotel was very clean and simple, and the staff was very helpful. Upon checking in, I recieved a card that gives guests free coffee and tea at any of the restaurants on site, plus $8 off any of their shows on site. The hotel is three separate buildings but rather close proximity to each other, however, being the average temp. while I was there was 40 degrees we did have to drive to each building, one for the pizza buffet which was very tasty, the grand country buffet, which had a good selection but very average in taste, a little pricey ($13 an adult for dinner), and the waterpark which was fun. We had a nice time at the hotel. The room is simple, two beds(very comfy and warm), bathroom(clean), tv. . . I could've used a microwave since we had breakfast in the room but I was able to rent a small fridge for a one time fee of $11 for my entire stay which was helpful. Every evening we came back to the room it was very clean. NO Complaints. The restaurants we went to were the Pizza buffet and the Grand Country buffet. The Pizza parlor was a fast and easy fare. The pizza was tasty and always plentiful. The staff seemed a bit worn or they must have been apprehensive about the 5 separate parties that were all booked at the same time and showed up very promptly(they just didn't look happy which makes you not want to bother them about requesting a type of pizza or tell them the soda machine needs changing). I recommend showing up early for pizza on the weekend. The country buffet we caught an hour before closing. The service was very good. The food on the other hand, though there was a great selection in foods and appearance seemed tasty, it was hardly anything to talk about. I guess our eyes were hungrier than our tummies because we were fooled. Basically it was bland. Every item was bland. The only thing I really liked was the bread pudding with vanilla cream sauce. I mean it was a nice last minute choice and it was close to our room so it was convenient, and right after we played mini golf which made it worthwhile. The activities they have at the hotel are the variety shows(which I didn't see), mini-golf which has a very neat atmosphere and was enjoyable(also a good alternative to the waterpark in cold weather), an arcade(not much to talk about), a swimming pool, and the waterpark. I didn't see any shows because I didn't think my two young children would sit through it. The mini-golf was cool for my kids, they learned how to play, it was fun, however we did the 36 hole and it may have been too long for a 4 & 6 year old. We played a couple of games. The swimming pool & hot tub was a nice alternative. And the waterpark, it was fun! Because of the time of year, it just felt chilly everywhere. It was warm in the building and the lazy river was warm(we spent most of out time in the lazy river), but the rest of the park was cool. My kids really enjoyed it, and didn't want to leave even though we were coming back the next day and the next. The "Fort" was cool, the big bucket fun, the waterslides were not so boring for my 6 yr.old but also not too scary for my 4 yr. old. My husband and I really enjoyed it. If it was a little warmer we would have enjoyed a lot more. The staff was helpful too. Overall, we would definitely come back and stay here. I think because we came in the off season we had a little more attention from the staff as far as friendliness, which was nice. And our stay ran into the beginning of the week so there was hardly anybody there. We had the waterpark all to ourselves on two of the days. It's busiest on Friday and saturday in the off season. The hotel is right on the strip, plenty of restaurants withing walking distance otherwise an easy drive to many places. And because we went in the off season and called for our reservations, if you go to their website they advertise $20 off the nightly rate with two night stay minimum, I paid only $59 on Saturday nite, and $39 for the next two nites. Very reasonable. The only thing I wish I could have changed was the weather. It was beautiful but cold. Our family is planning for another trip during warmer weather. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: OldOkie
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable but there was a live scorpion in the bath when we arrived which I stepped on, sorry PETA. lol. The indoor water park was better than the average pool and jacuzzi by far. My grandson had a great time there. The buffet was not very good, not a good selection or quality of food. The location was great right on the strip but just a block away from green mountain road so its easy to avoid the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “"Don't Stay Here!"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I along with our 6 & 9 year old stayed here on our 1st visit to Branson. We had a king with sleeper sofa, for which the kids only had 1 pillow! Our king size bed was so hard we could barely stand the next day, no kidding! The light in the bath didn't work nor did the the plug-in. We had to wait every morning for hot water if the room next to us was running the water. The carpet was dirty, room too small. Our phone had no directions on how to use. The hot tub in another building was so far away we had to drive there and it was very small & dirty. The indoor pool in that building was freezing cold! If we needed something from housekeeping, we couldn't communicate with them because they didn't speak English. The outdoor pool was very small and had no privacy fence blocking it from the busy Hwy76. The children did love the indoor waterpark although they got bored with it because it is so small. The outdoor waterpark(when it was open) was okay but caters more to children even younger than my 6 year old. Every other hotel/motel in Branson has a free continental breakfast, at $99 a night Grand Central should have one. Good point: The animal comedy show at the Grand Central is hilarious, it had a few boring minutes but was well worth the price, the kids loved it! And at check-in we received a discount card for $8 off each ticket. In no way would I recommend this hotel to anyone. Don't be tempted with the 2 waterparks & 2 pools, it's not worth it. Take your family to a hotel that is worth the $99 a night! E & family

Reviews.Title: “Fun for Kids”
Reviews.Author: ImaBeachbum
Reviews.Content: Our family was at Grand Country for two days over spring break. The indoor waterpark is a great idea for year-round fun. It is COLD when you get outside, though. The water is heated in the lazy river, but not the bucket and treehouse. They have plenty of lifeguards and towels in the park. There are two hot tubs in the building, but they stay full. Expect to be overrun with children wherever you are. If you are going just for the waterpark, get building 1. We had building 3 and had to drive. Building 2 is in the middle and has an indoor pool and hot tub next door to it. Parking is a definite problem around the waterpark. The dinner buffet was good, but kind of overpriced. The rooms were adequate and clean. Even for the price, we would stay there again because it gives the kids plenty to do when you can't get outside. They absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Country Inn over spring break... the kids had a great time! I've read alot of complaints about the towels, we actually brought our own for that reason, but the staff had so many towels it was unneccessary. The one mistake I made was thinking that the water park was somehow connected to the hotel. When we paid the extra money we thought we would be staying warm going from the water park to the hotel, but we froze going back and forth! Definitely bring a bath robe to wear! The rooms were not the best, but fine for the kids. All rooms are entered from outside... we didn't know that either. The kids (ages 8-13) never got bored! The hotel was great for the price. Very cheap compared to the others!

Reviews.Title: “Worth it~”
Reviews.Author: towerbug
Reviews.Content: We were assigned a room different than requested but after phoning, they were willing to accommodate us. We refused and decided to stay after all. We were assigned a handicap room with one large king bed instead of the requested two beds. However, this room was very very clean and spacious; the bathroom was large enough for wheelchair. In fact, large enough for a table and two chairs! The bed was very, very comfortable. We were, however, near the stairs and boy was it noisy. There were little girls running the outside corridor until midnight!!! (((Hello, parents???))) But it did quiet down. The rooms provide NO coffee pots or microwaves...anywhere! You will get a coupon for free coffee/ice tea at their restaurants though. The breakfast buffet was better than expected. Lots of variety and tasty. (I was afraid after reading some of the reviews). The room we were assigned was way across the parking lot from the waterpark. In cool March weather, we had to drive to it. The waterpark was all open and very worth it. Our children loved it. (Husband, too!!) I would recommend this hotel, buffet and waterpark. We had a great time. $$$

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time here last week, the kids really enjoyed the water park, and really if you compare the price for the park and hotel, it is really a good deal. The food at both the pizza place, and buffett was great and a real value. The shows were somewhat weak, that was the only thing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was a little smaller than what I thought it was going to be, but it was very clean. Our housekeeper was very good and had no problems with giving us extra towels everyday. The close proximity of the waterpark, arcade, mini golf, pizza parlor, etc was great for my pre-teen girls. They weren't bored for a minute! It made for the perfect winter trip. The staff was very kind and helpful directing us around Branson during our stay. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE KAGEN!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i went to the grand country on may 21 2004. i went with my friends and i had so much fun. the waterpark was awesome and the lifeguards were so sweet we met one named kagen and he was so nice. i cant wait to go back so i can see him again. i think when i get older i will move to branson. i am going back over the summer and i cant wait. I would stay at the grand country inn everytime i go to branson. kagen if u read this, i love you you are so awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Heartwarming Story”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Grand Country Inn in December for a Friday/Saturday night stay. While we were at Silver Dollar City on Saturday, our three year old son had a seizure and was flown by helicopter to a Springfield hospital. We spent three days in the Pediatric Intensive Care Unit there. We were unable to get back to Branson to remove out items from our room in time for check out and the managment was completely understanding. They were so concerned about the health of our little boy rather than the fact that they were losing money from our room being occupied by our stuff. In addition to their heartfelt concern, the general manager contacted me asking how our son was doing. When I told her that all he was concerned about was going back to their hotel, she called the owner. He refunded our money for the Saturday night that we were unable to spend at the hotel so that we would have money to return!!! These people are geniunely good. Everything might not be perfect at their hotel, but what place is?! If you want to support people who care more about the people who visit their attraction more than the money they make, this is the ONLY place to stay. That is what life is about--- families looking out for other families. I encourage you stay here and show these kind hearted people that we respect what they value most... family! Chad and Brandy Criss

Reviews.Title: “Stay for the Waterpark Only”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a few problems at check-in, and were disappointed that some part of the water park was always closed. Management told us that they didn't have enough staff, so they'd close the Lazy River for a few hours, then open that back up and close the pool with the basketball hoops instead, and so on. Even our children were a bit disappointed with the water park. The rooms were very basic, a bit shabby even, and not very clean. Also, the TV was small and had few channels. The towels were tiny and thin. I'm not sure whether we will stay there again. Although the water park is a nice option during the winter, the price is too high for what you get.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Country Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 1945 West Highway 76, Branson, MO 65616
